result.name: Alexandra Palace
result.address: Alexandra Palace Way, London N22 7AY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I went here for the first time a couple of months ago to see The Libertines when they played their two dates here. It's worth visiting this place for the view alone, but as a venue it's great in that it holds a really good number of people, the right size for it to feel fairly intimate but still big enough to attract big acts. Plus there's always two big screens set up so if you are struggling to see the main stage, you'll still not miss any of the excitement.
The one drawback is the prices of beer and food when you're there, but the venue is not to blame for this, and it's always to be expected anyway!
A great venue for some great acts. Highly recommended.

Alexander Palace is a place I have loved visiting and driving through since I was a kid. I always would ask my mum to take a detour via Alexander Palace to see the magnificent views over London. This North London hotspot is a nice getaway from busy London with large grounds, a small boating lake, deer and a nice place to eat and drink. Instead of paying the high prices to see the city from places like the Shard or the London Eye why not try a free trip to Ally Pally as it has been affectionately nicknamed.

AMAZING! Really good venue, just spectacular! Get there super early if going for a gig though because its huge and if you're at the back you will see nothing because they dont have any screens! If you want the front then you should honestly be there about 10 hours early! No exaggeration

Alexandra Palace is definitely a place to see if only for the stunning London skyline view. Located in North London, the view is a 15 min walk/10 min bus ride from the station. One of the best places to watch the fireworks on bonfire night, the view will make it worth the trip, especially at nighttime. Alexandra Palace in itself also hosts loads of interesting exhibits which give plenty of excuses to go and peek at the London skyline over and over again.

Alexandra Palace is a fabulous place. My wife and I spent an extraordinary day at Alexandra Palace Ice Rink. We love it. We had a lot of funny situations over the ice especially me with my two left legs. Definitely go and visit it .

result.name: The Cavendish London
result.address: 81 Jermyn Street, London SW1Y 6JF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: if you like indian food please Try The Taj Restaurant in 10 Carlton Parade Orpington Kent BR6 0JB open 7 days a week Monday to Saturday 5.30pm to 11.30pm and Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm

I stayed here for two nights recently, having arrived at the hotel at 7:30AM - much too early to check in at most hotels. The front desk, however, was extremely accommodating and provided me with a room! 

Only thing I had an issue with was the bathroom tub door - the seal at the bottom was not tight, and so when showering, water would leak out and drip onto the floor. The first time this happened my floor was partially flooded - I ended up putting towels there as a preemptive measure.

The Cavendish Hotel is a hipsters paradise, cool, quiet and this hipster chick loves that. I do want to party when I come to London, but want to keep the party in the club not bring it back to the hotel. My life is more about having an atmosphere to work and create then be the life of the party. I love a hotel that can pamper by just having the little things that I need at my figure tips. The staff was incredible from check in to check out. The staff was pleasurable and charming, so on my next visit to London you will know where to find me at The Cavendish Hotel.

Very pleased - although I only stayed for a single night I found the hotel staff in particular very helpful and accomodating. The concierge even rushed a suit of mine to another hotel for overnight dry cleaning as I had arrived too late to make use of the Cavendish's own service - and he collected it for me at 6am the following morning. I will be staying here again when I am next in the area.
Stayed July 2013 for one night on business

What can I say about this wonderful hotel ?? I was lucky enough to win an overnight stay in an Executive Room on the 10th Floor ! What a treat ! The views across London were stunning - we could see The London Eye, Big Ben, Westminster and the Shard easily from our window.The comfort of the bed was simply divine - the best I have ever had in a London hotel. The Nespresso coffee machine was a welcome surprise and the pods were even replenished while we were out at the theatre - hows that for service! All the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming - nothing was too much trouble. The hotel had booked us tickets for Singin in The Rain which was an absolute delight and the seats were excellent. Breakfast was fabulous - I particularly liked how each item was locally sourced and labelled where it was from. The hotels own home made marmalade is a gastronomic treat for the taste-buds( how I wish I had taken a little pot home !) The Cavendish is in an ideal central location where many of London's attractions are only a short walk away. I would recommend The Cavendish to anyone wanting great service and a little luxury - I absolutely loved it and hope to stay again.

result.name: Bar Soho
result.address: 23-25 Old Compton Street, London W1D 5JL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: An interesting fairground/punk mash up interior. Quite small, but the seating arrangement is not crowded. The music is a little too loud, I couldn't hear a word the bartender was saying but that may just be me. What really did it for me was the price of the drinks; happy hour is from 5 till 8 with 50% of all cocktails, champagnes, etc... not just cheap, select drinks. Located close to the Prince Theatre so it would be a decent place to go to before your show starts.
Good music nice mix..but for drinks it took forever... But still worth a visit friendly atmosphere bit small but just right worth a visit..

An old favourite in the heart of Soho. Full of young Londoners and tourists. Cocktails are pretty expensive. A standard selection of beers. Can get pretty busy on Friday and Saturday nights. Expect a few drunk people in there.

I ve been a customer for bar soho for at least 4 years but every year this place is getting worse and worse. Last night got almost kicked out on my birthday party ( where was aroud 30 people) by on of duty manager for trying to talk to a door man about how many people are still gona join me. the 'manager ' name Dan came towards me with bad behaviour, violent, unactetable towards woman. he doesnt wona listen what i have to say... called another fat security guy and when i was on my own they stopped me at the stairs and harrased me with police. i went outside and my husband called a general manager which he appoligize for his employee behaviour trying to explained him as he was very tired.... it makes me laught hearing that. on top of that the same security guy which kick me out started to lying on front of me that he asked me politely. joke joke joke. AVOID THAT PLACE... THERE IS A LOT OF DIFFERENT ONE NEXT DOOR WITH MUCH BETTER ATMOSPHERE. the last what u need on your birthday to be treated like that

Quant bar. Great service and prices. Loved this bar. The bar tenders where nice, cocktails made well and atmosphere electric. 

So much character at this bar. Would love to come again.

result.name: The Dorchester
result.address: 53 Park Lane, Mayfair, London W1K 1QA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Unfortunately owned by the Sultan of Brunei, which means it is subsidizing a repressive absolute monarchy.

I have been visiting the Dorchester grill for my birthday over the last few years and always love it. Formal, but personal and so nice to get dressed up and be waited on. I would highly recommend a visit for dinner.
Fantastic food and lovely staff
Very sumptous fine dining experience. It has 3 stars but the food was more the level of 2 stars. Which is still excellent, just not as memorable. Highly recommended.
I love it ,it help me a lot during my trips to london

result.name: Criterion Restaurant
result.address: 224 Piccadilly, London W1J 9HP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: If you are looking for a great restaurant with a relaxing atmosphere and nice looking décor, then you have to visit the Criterion Restaurant. I am not the kind of person that can be easily pleased but this place just got to me. The food was simply delectable and the staff was very friendly. If you are looking for a restaurant that you and perhaps with your friends, family or kids, going to this place is highly recommended.
Really nice place, good service and good food. Perfect for a meal before or after theatre. The afternoon tea is really good!

I took my wife there for Valentines Day which also is her Birthday. The history of the restaurant is very well maintained in its ambience. Very friendly staff, great food, we tried the lamb and it was just right. Will definitely be going again.
Excellent food and good value for money.
Had a mid week lunch which was excellent afternoon. As always meal & service quality.

result.name: Heaven
result.address: The Arches, Villiers Street, London WC2N 6NG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Myself and two other friends (all gay) attended the venue on Thursday evening. After roughly an hour or so actually in the venue dancing and having only ONE drink (worth mentioning this was all of our 3rd drink of the entire night) we decided it was cigarette time, so we proceeded to the outside smoking area.
 
After our smoke we re-approached the entrance only to be told that we were not allowed back in because we had "had too much to drink". This was of course absurd and very confusing as we had literally had one drink in your venue and 2 prior to this, so we were not even on the cusp of tipsy. The doorman who initially refused our entry first picked out one of the three of us as being "too intoxicated" and after our friend proved he was not, the doorman then decided to pick on me because I had a limp. 
 
This instantly proved that the doorman and the rest of your "security team" were simply trying to minimise numbers in the venue by any means, and after being told that my limp was due to a Car Accident, the doorman then said, and I quote "walk for me", I found this extremely unfair, belittling and a complete abuse of my human rights.
 
Another doorman on the door told this other guy that we were all fine as he has initially let us in when we arrived, and he felt there was no reason to refuse us entry, so after our jackets were disgusting chucked at us, we were allowed back in. We spent a maximum of about 15 more minutes in the venue before deciding ourselves to leave, due to the fact our evening in Heaven had been too tarnished with abuse, prejudice behaviour and a complete disregard for our human rights.
 
We then went onto have some food and proceed home.
 
This email is prelude to a much larger bombardment on the venue and staff as I will be taking this further and posting it on every social media platform I know, and will also be asking if any of the local Brighton, London and south eastern papers would like to be involved in exposing the sort of behaviour your venue has promoted.
 
Also, as an ex venue promoter for Brighton and Hove, I know exactly how the club circuit works, especially gay venues and this was an awful representation of what should be a warm, welcoming and comfortable industry to be a part of, be it as a customer or employee.
 
I am not a greedy, selfish, or abrupt person. However after this atrocious behaviour, I do believe we deserve some form of apology, I especially after being told my temporary disability was fake and being made to walk purely for the amusement of a corrupt and unprofessional "doorman".
 
Also none of this is even remotely exaggerated and the CCTV will contest to that, in fact the above if anything is underplayed.

I visited with Freddie Shuffrey (see his review) and would like to add that, while I had a great time overall, I was forced to wait over half an hour for a glass of water while many male customers were served more quickly around me, and when I asked for water, I was told to 'go away' because I had expressed frustration at being so blatantly ignored, despite not behaving aggressively or rudely. It took other customers insisting on my being served for me to be provided with water. I will not be going to Heaven again as the staff was so rude and I did not feel comfortable as a queer woman in what should be an inclusive LGBTQIA venue.

The sad thing is that my party actually enjoyed our time INSIDE Heaven. It was the treatment we got outside that causes this review. Some of the bouncers were abominably rude to us, even though as a party of 15+ we were clearly going to be buying quite a few drinks. The female bouncer was particularly nasty and unhelpful. Despite me phoning up the day before to explicitly ask Heaven if getting a guest list would mean that we'd be able to get in hassle-free on Friday night at 12:30, the bouncer at the door told me this was "complete rubbish", begging the question what on earth is the point of a guest list if people can't get in? One of my party was arbitrarily barred from going in for asking about the guest list system. Two stars and unlikely to receive another visit from me or any of my friends, especially when hired bouncers, ESPECIALLY the female bouncer on Friday nights, are extremely rude and unhelpful to paying customers.

Pathetic little place. I was refused to enter and said I had too much to drink. Came especially with 16 friends and I was turned away. I did not have a drink and just finished work. I have a slight disability and I walk ''funny'' and that what I think was it. Thank you idiots for ruining my night. Also spoke to the 'manager'. Security pointed to a guy completely stoned, he did not said a word when I complained. Not sure of security either the guys didn't have their SIS Badges and refused to give their names. Places like this one should be closed down.

This is one of the best gay clubs I’ve ever been to!! I am loooving it! The crowd is wild and it can get very wild and crazy and you must be prepared for anything, hot and body to body dancing on the dancefloor and much more I guess the name of the club speaks for itself!

result.name: Ronnie Scott's
result.address: 47 Frith Street, London W1D 4HT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: My friends and I had an amazing 'night of jazz'. Great music, relaxing atmosphere and so much fun - all in one place. I recommend it to anyone who wants to enjoy fine music.

Central London venue for Jazz. Music every night from about 7pm-3am. You need to book to be sure of getting in. Lovely room, but cramped as they have shoe-horned in as many tables as they can; it still sells out many nights. Table service for bar & food. Food is good quality but you pay for the music, ambience, excellent service and high overheads with a large bill at the end of the night. Good value for a special night out.

Went on a Saturday night to the upstairs bar. Atmosphere was awesome; really busy, great music playing, décor was oozing cool. The only problem was that there was a fair bit of annoyance on the dance floor when the DJ insisted on dragging out the bassline of all the songs for like ten minutes. Was a great night but shame about the DJ.

I came here to see the Brubeck sons, which was suitably mind-blowing for a first visit to Ronnie's. The decor place is set up so that all tables have a good view of the stage, but you'll want to get there early (or be a member) to nab the top spots. Service is wonderful, but unfortunately the food is certainly not the star of the show - better to eat beforehand and stick to drinks.

Been here a few times. I'm not a major jazz critic but to chill with good cocktails and flow with the music is something not too be missed! Rated the house band better than the guest acts on both occasions but that's just me. Defiantly a place to keep in mind if visiting or planning a night out.

result.name: Roundhouse
result.address: Chalk Farm Road, London NW1 8EH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: The Roundhouse is easily one of my favourite venues in London. A vast space with incredible acoustics. As part of the 'Get In' initiative (for 16 to 25 year olds) I regularly attend creative sessions and cheap gigs here. Over the iTunes festival 2014 I was lucky enough to attend a large number of shows and was amazed at the versatility of the venue and how it was adapted to the artists different styles.

I was there earlier this year to see Neutral Milk Hotel. It was my first time there, and it was a sold-out event. I arrived late so was stuck at the back and couldn't see too well, but the atmosphere and intimacy of the place meant that I still had a really great evening and it was clear that everybody there was a devoted fan.
It's a venue that seems to attract the best bands and also well-behaved crowds, and although it can fit a good number of people in it still manages to feel contained.
Highly recommended!

Such an amazing venue! Cool place for gigs. I was very lucky to attend 3 performances for iTunes Festival 2014 courtesy of my bf. I saw David Gray, Nicola Beneddeti, Milos, And Placido Domingo performed in different occasions. The venue is just so perfect in size and you could have a decent view of the stage from any angle. Great sound and lighting as well. I must say it was a mind blowing experience. 
Hope to come back again for iTunes 2015!

iTunes Festival 2014 - deadmau5

Staff were all very friendly and courteous, a well organised queue and ticketing system kept waiting times to a minimum. 

Great bar inside with some fantastic beers sourced from a local independent brewery.

Some brilliant performances, an equally awesome sound system, and a fantastic venue all contributed to a thoroughly enjoyable evening.

Hope to visit again.
My favourite show venue in London; great atmosphere and acoustics yet very intimate - great proportion of bars and toilets to people as well!

result.name: fabric
result.address: 77A Charterhouse Street, London EC1M 6HJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Second time I have been here and have been kicked out for no reason. They must be broke and trying to get more people in. I travelled over 2000miles to come here the music in this club. But when I bought a beer and was unsatisfied with how it was poured, the blame was brought to me and because I refused to pay for it they kicked me out. What Chafs, Scum bags!

The vibe is great, the crowd is there for fun, not for being posey or stuck-up and the live gigs are mind-blowing, so if you are into Drum & Bass beats, this is your place to be!!!! I’ve seen some negative reviews on here, but from the many times I’ve been here, I can’t recall, nothing but fun and dancing all night long to the beats, so I think you gotta check it out first for yourself, before to make up your mind.

Great venue and great sound! Ambience that makes you want to dance all night long, so if you want to have a great night life experience, you must go with your friends, put something more comfortably on and forget about all the fuss of the fancy and ultra-expensive night cubs and just let the great drum and bass don’t let you sit all night long!

love that place! Many rooms with superb sound and star djs every weekend. But also damned security guys on every meter literally scanning you for drugs. Im dont take any chem stuff like extasy etc..,but common guys really cant i have a joint?!?

Fabric is without doubt one of the best club venues I've ever been to. A labyrinth of rooms, with the most amazing sound system I've ever heard. The crowd.. hm.. I suppose with such a reputation you're going to get a good handful of people you'd probably not want to share a night with. But that's why you have friends, right? Make sure you leave late enough to catch the meat market in full swing. And yeah, I really mean a market that sells animal meat.

result.name: The Swan Shakespeare's Globe
result.address: 21 New Globe Walk, London SE1 9DT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Booked a table for afternoon tea yesterday with family and a German visitor. Restaurant has impressive view of the river and is nicely decorated. The staff were friendly and efficient. However, other things did not live up to expectations. My wife told me that the ladies washroom was not as clean as it might have been and to say the the food was disappointing would be an understatement. The sandwiches and rolls were stale, the pastries disappointing, but the scones with cream were delicious. My tea (liquorice and ?) had a sickly taste and I was unable to finish it. My wife's Earl Grey was watery, despite allowing infusion time. For £20 a head, I would have expected much better. Have no intention of returning. Didn't make a fuss at the time because we didn't want to embarrass our visitor. One star purely for the polite staff.

I was booked as a wedding photographer here and was appalled by the attitude of the events manager.

On the day it was raining heavily and I needed to take some shots of the bride and groom inside. Suitable spots were very limited, so I wanted to use a very quiet corner of the room the the couple had booked for their ceremony and wedding breakfast. The events manager absolutely refused to let me do this until about two minutes before the beginning of the meal. I don't know why, as I would have been completely out of the way of all catering staff preparing the room. The manager didn't seem to have any reason that she could explain and was extremely hostile and unhelpful.

As a result I had a ridiculously short time to take photos of the bride and groom, and it nearly wrecked their wedding photos. I photograph a lot of weddings and I know how to keep out of the way and not cause problems, in return I hope for a bit of cooperation from venues and their staff. In this case I didn't get any.

After the wedding I wrote a complaint to the manager of the Swan but got no reply. I wrote again and still no reply. Even if they disagreed with everything I'd said, I would have expected them to write and tell me why, but nothing. I'd advise you to spend your money somewhere else, especially if you are getting married!
A beautifully decorated restaurant, which is well located and has fantastic views. Clearly very popular and had a nice atmosphere. High standard of food and drink.
I was here in a rainy day so I couldn’t take the best of the view but the tasty food definitely compensated it. The roast pork belly I had was very delicious.

I have never been to the Globe before and I got to see one of my favorite shakespeare shows when I went for the first time. One, the facility is beautiful, I am so impressed at how well they've kept it and how wonderful it looks. I luckily went on a sunny day so it wasn't rainy or uncomfortable. I highly recommend doing the £5 groundling ticket just because of the experience. The actors interacted with us we were right in the action. I felt like I was back in the Elizabethean times watching a performance.

result.name: Electric Ballroom
result.address: 184 Camden High Street, London NW1 8QP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Be careful in there.. pick pocked operate inside!
They even hold a sign up at the start saying so! 

I went last night and me as 20 to 30 others got robbed! lucky they found a bag of phones in the loo and we got them back! I never had this done to me and i was pretty sober.

We spent a lot of time here this weekend for Desertfest and I have to say, it is a great venue! They have 3 bars so you don't have to wait too long for drinks and no matter how far away you are from the stage, you are almost guaranteed a good view! (I think the angle of the floor is subtle and the stage is just high enough to make a difference!) They have an upstairs mezzanine area also so if you don't want to be in the thick of it or want to chill in a booth, the option is there. Of course, the sound depends on a variety of factors but when these lined up, the riffs were crisp and the vocals audible enough to sing along with! The staff that work there are helpful and lovely also. Good place for a big rock gig!

Have you been to potterrow or indeed any student union ever? Electric Ballroom replicates the mix of cheesy and current music, cheap drinks and huge mix of people with varied interests in it's several large rooms. There's often a queue but it moves quickly and there's always space to dance. Sticky floors are made up for by the prices- it won't break your bank.
Cool place to see bands. Bark sweaty. Nice sound system and good views of the stage from anywhere in the main room.

Came here for the Zedd concert. The sound system is pretty good! The atmosphere was pretty chilled and it was a nice place for a good concert. The toilets are located upstairs and the bar's prices are quite fair - around 4.20 for a pint of lager and spirits cost around a fiver. I wouldn't mind coming back for another gig.

result.name: Boisdale of Canary Wharf
result.address: Cabot Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 4QT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Fantastic restaurant! 

My favourite in Canary Wharf. Great for lunch or dinner and the haggis definitely has to be tried (am a big fan). Evenings feature great jazz and blues live. It's well worth booking a table in advance as it can get very busy. 

Celebrated my doctoral graduation there and we were really well looked after. Highly recommended if you're in the area.
Absolutely fabulous can not wait to return

We booked a few weeks in advance an offer ( Chateaubriand, lobster, prosecco and dessert ) for £29.50 .
The day of the reservation we received a telephone call that this offer was not available for that evening and we can only have the menu meals . No explanation was given why this offer was not available. Also can we make a decision quickly if we still want a table for that evening.
And by the way you will have to leave before the Jazz band will start playing.
The girl we have spoken to was rude and unfriendly so without any hesitation we cancelled and will not book there again !! The Plateau is a better option in Canary Wharf

This is the place to go for a posh drink with a mate. It just has that feel of power, prestige, and yes, money. Yet despite all that, if you rock up in jeans and a backpack they don’t really mind (as long as you look decent – I’m not walking around in Lycra) which is refreshing, particularly for the Wharf. 

Obviously, I love the bar, particularly given the level of care the bartender took in selecting the right bourbon then the exacting process to prepare my Old Fashioned. 

The ground floor is dominated by the centre bar with a sprinkling of tables scattered around. Tucked away to the side is a cigar room. Yes, that’s right, an entire room devoted to cigars that includes a section with very comfortable leather armchairs where you can sit and puff away. 

Upstairs there is a full restaurant with one of the largest bar displays you’ll ever see – and of particular interest to me was the massive whiskey selection. I haven't eaten here yet but will update when I eventually do.

Had a fantastic lunch here with JP Morgan. Amazing steak. It's the only restaurant that did welsh rarebit on the menu as a desert. Needless to say all 4 of us ate it and loved it. Definitely coming here again.

result.name: Royal Court Bar
result.address: Royal Court Theatre, 50-51 Sloane Square, London SW1W 8AS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I went to the Royal Court to see the wonderful Andrew Scott perform in Birdland. The staff were extremely helpful when I called to change my tickets to another date as I had accidentally booked them a week earlier than I meant to.

The more stage shows I see the more fascinated I am by how each production uses the stage area and with Birdland there was no exception. A lot of the action took place on those six lit up chairs that you can see with the actors not taking part in that particular scene facing away from the audience or dimmed by light. The stage is also surrounded by a moat of water which plays an interesting part towards the end as well. It gets more chaotic as the play progresses which is of course symbolism of Paul’s own mindset.

If the phrase "a stone's throw away" is applicable anywhere, it's here! Quite literally next to Sloane Square, in the very heart of London's trendy Chelsea district, is The Royal Court Theatre. My boyfriend and I recently went as first time patrons to watch Death Tax, a postmodernist play acted by a cast of upcoming dramatic talent, and the theatre impressed at every turn. Wonderfully helpful staff, an awesome bar fit for the young and budding to the corporate and sophisticated. Great for theatre lovers and theatre newbies!

I've only just come across the Royal Court, having mainly visited the West End theatres. I had been searching around for more shows and you can't believe how surprised I was to find out they do standing tickets at just 10p! You do miss out on quite a bit of the stage, but it's a small price to pay when paying a very small price!

Every show I've seen at The Royal Court have been of a really high standard - even shows I wouldn't say I 'enjoyed' have left a lasting impression. I'm looking forward to seeing the NTS production of 'Let The Right One In' this Christmas as an alternative to panto. The bar is spacious and is used well with singers, performers and special events where you can meet playwrights and directors. The bookshop is a small but impressive selection of new and classics texts, and watch out for their special sales to pick up some real bargains. The Royal Court also has possibly the comfiest theatre seats in their main stage space. That may seem like a relatively unimportant aspect of your theatre experience but having paid a decent amount of money at bigger theatres to then be distracted through the performance by having a numb bum...not ideal! They're lovely bucket style, and work in the lovely auditorium space. Looking forward to see what Vicky Featherstone does here.

THIS IS the place for new and cutting edge theatre in London. They have staged some of the most successful plays of recent times including Jez Butterworth's Jerusalem. The bar is a great place to hang out in the interval or just as a separate visit. You are sure to see some intellectuals and hear some stimulating conversation.

result.name: The Landmark London
result.address: 222 Marylebone Road, London NW1 6JQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Stayed in a suite here (not on my own dime, mind you, since I'm not sure I even had a dime at the time) the first time I went to London. I wasn't into the idea of navigating London by car the first time I landed there (or ever, frankly), so Marylebone station being right outside the "back door" couldn't have been more convenient. 

Did you know that Marylebone is where the opening scene of A Hard Day's Night was filmed? You probably did, since you're an Internet nerd reading hotel reviews on Google. I imagine a lot of things happened on that street that are less famous and just as interesting. 

The Landmark was The Hotel Grand Central when it was built in the 1890s by some railroad tycoon. Those were the days, weren't they, when we had railroad tycoons and steel magnates and robber barons under every rock, amassing ridiculous personal wealth on top of mountains of dead serfs. Ah, nostalgia!

As for hotel specifics, I hardly remember anything, other than very grand staircases and the strange sensation that I was missing something every time I came back to the room in the evening after housekeeping had been to visit. Reminded me of staying in the Hotel St. Paul in the 70s when it was little more than a flophouse and having the maid, such as she was, pilfer my bottle of whiskey from the dresser drawer. I was just a teenager, so when I went to the front desk to complain, the guy squinted at me for a few seconds, told me to "fuck off," and went back to watching a football game on a tiny black and white TV. But I showed him. I went back up to my room, removed the screens from all of the windows and tossed them down into the overgrown "courtyard" below. Like I said, I was a teenager. But it was much more enjoyable in the room with proper ventilation, that's a fact. The mosquitoes were worse, but you'd expect that.

Ah, London, right. Nice hotel. Though I spent most of my time at Pinewood Studios or wandering the city trying to get lost. An activity I heartily recommend any time you find yourself in a new place. Just go out and start walking, or get on a train going in some random direction. That's the best way to see what's really going on wherever you are. Most of the time you can eventually make it back to your bed. When you can't, well, that's where you get stories to tell, isn't it.
Fantastic hotel in a great location! I've stayed here 3 times and have loved it every time

Really grand experience and a lovely place to settle for a nice afternoon tea. They have a few different seasonal tea themes to pick from. The staff are really knowledgeable when it comes to the tea as well as being really friendly. The afternoon tea here is more on the expensive side compared to other like-for-like hotels, but probably because the hotel is much larger.
Fantastic hotel ,good location,nice staff.

The entrance and bar of the hotel are in the "great glass room" within the hotel. the rooms are expensive but spacious although on the expensive side. the food is excellent on the second floor and also is great value for what it is. a real find in the capital. would recommend to anyone visiting the city

result.name: The Connaught
result.address: Carlos Place, Mayfair, London W1K 2AL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Lovely Mayfair hotel and one of the most elegantly discreet in London. Highly recommended are the Cocktail Bar and especially the Coburg Bar. Fantastic afternoon teas. Very very enjoyable place. 5 stars.

The Connaught's Bar was my special treat to myself on my last night in London. Renowned for their fantastic cocktails, I decided to indulge. Both the service and drinks were incredible. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a very, very classy night out. Be prepared to feel much lighter in your pocketbook.

I came here for afternoon tea but left feeling quite disappointed. For what it consisted of, it was hideously overpriced. The sandwiches were so small I could have fit two of them in my mouth at the same time and the sweets were far too sweet.

The staff were polite but some of them didn't speak very clearly and it was difficult for the non-native English speakers with me to understand.

I have had much better afternoon teas for less than half the price with a much more personal touch.
A hotel where you can experience luxury. I brought my wife here during our anniversary last month and she really enjoyed the night. I am glad I to make her feel special in one way or another.
A fabulous chic bar in the heart of Mayfair. Definitely in my Top Five Bars in London. Dress to impress. Special martini trolley where the mixologist makes the drink infront of you. Very quirky!

result.name: Prospect Of Whitby
result.address: 57 Wapping Wall, Wapping, London E1W 3SH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Fourth of the crawl. Absolute beaut of a bar with an excellent riverside view. Nicely priced beer but terrible chat up lines by the locals. No time for the cold shoulder.

Live music is coming up and we're waiting on that whilst the fireworks are going off over the river. Can see a nice view of Canary Wharf whilst soaking up the outside ambiance!

New menu too which is strangely similar to The Narrow.

After an exhausting workday, there is nothing better than a cold beer at Prospect of Whitby. Me and my colleagues visit this place very often. Nice atmosphere, traditional British food and good service - what could we want more!? The burgers are great - my favourite one is Taylor Walker.

Wikipedia says, "The Prospect of Whitby is a historic public house on the banks of the Thames at Wapping in the London Borough of Tower Hamlets. It lays claim to being the site of the oldest riverside tavern, dating from around 1520. It was formerly known as the Devil’s Tavern, on account of its dubious reputation. Before that it was officially called The Pelican. All that remains from the building’s earliest period is the 400 year old stone floor. In former times it was a meeting place for sailors, smugglers, cut-throats and footpads. Sir Hugh Willoughby sailed from here in 1533 in a disastrous attempt to discover the North-East Passage to China."

But i say... bloody good pub!

Whilst this is a beautiful old pub steeped in History with a wonderful location overlooking the Thames, I will never return here for more than a drink. Came for a meal on Sunday, the roasts were measly portions, potatoes looked more boiled than roasted, and two out of six people came down that evening with the most horrendous food poisoning! Both had lamb (one had lamb shoulder, the other lamb roast)

My favorite pub. It has a soul and character. It has very great view of the River Thames and the Canary Wharf buildings. Good selection of beer. Yummy food. And it is just a few minutes walk away from home. :)

result.name: Grosvenor House
result.address: 86-90 Park Lane, London W1K 7TN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This hotel is really impressive. I stayed here overnight and was quite impressed with the service level and furnishings. The security is also quite tight during the evening, which is a good thing. I would recommend this hotel, but as it is fancy, it is quite pricey.

Really fancy hotel! I only ever attended one event there but the Great Room is huge with room for a stage, numerous tables and a dance floor. I don't think I've ever been to a dinner that fancy. Their food is also really really delicious. Service is superb!

Wonderful and historic hotel on Park Lane across from Hyde Park. Impeccable service and commitment to guests. Brilliant steaks and crab cakes at JW Steakhouse. One of the best high teas in the city--delicious and elegant. The Red Bar is hip, beautiful, and totally creative. And a top-notch fitness centre helps to reduce guilt from over indulging.
Lovely room and excellent breakfast room, with a visa lie chef making eggs and waffles to order.
Great location, in 15 minutes you can arrive at Buckingham Palace walking. The staff is very polite and friendly. Breakfast is very good and rooms are very large and comfortable.

result.name: Simpson's-in-the-Strand
result.address: 100 Strand, London WC2R 0EW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Gorgeous dining experience, from the food to the presentation to the service and servers. Highly recommend. The one flaw is that there is basically one vegetarian entree or you can order from the side dishes but the puddings are out of this world.

Great place, staff very kind, we received a complete explanation for all dishes. The taste was superbe. There is a complete wine list and you can experience the atmosphere of a classic, ancient british club. For that luxury the prices aren't too high. A restaurant you can't miss if you're serching something really traditional british.
I was treated to Simpson's on the Stand during a business trip. What a pleasure it was to experience authentic English fine dining. The food was excellent and the service even better than the food.
Perfect service, great food and an old world British atmosphere. Worth every penny!

A reservation was made for a late lunch and from the moment of arrival our party was treated with care and attention. Service was prompt, helpful and yet not intrusive. There were a number of extra touches such as provision of a special starter for one member who did not order a regular item. Full explanation of dishes and time frame of service of that item was given. All menu items were served beautifully, were hot when appropriate and extremely tasteful and delicious, I would highly recommend the beef wellington, well worth the extra time to prepare it. Desserts were also superb. A wonderful time was had by all and I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone for a special occasion or someone wanting superb food.

result.name: Tattershall Castle
result.address: Victoria Embankment, Whitehall, London SW1A 2HR, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Great ship. But try to organise an event there, forget it, took a week to make a booking as are very slow at responding with detail/answers. They are no help at all for simple things, like providing a private spot for a hired professional Santa to change for 5 minutes, except in a toilet, despite paying £100 for booking and providing people drinking at their venue. 

On many occasions asked questions multiple times with no answer. And when wanted to do £16 per person buffet of food, got attitude like i'm being difficult. Originally was doing the £12.95 buffet, so was providing another £3 per person. Odd. This reply consisted of a suggestion to find another venue and will get my full deposit back. If wasn't 4 days prior I would. A quote I like "I’ve never had some much trouble trying to organize such a small party!" I have 30 ppl. Talk about stuck up. Id expect the same effort if it was 5 people or 50. In the end they cancelled my booking 2 days prior as I complained about the customer service but really they wanted the room for a larger group I found out.

Will pop in for my drinks now and then as I do but won't again organize a event with them.

After waiting 40 min for my food, I decided to ask what the hold up was since the people that arrived after me were already eating their lunch. They didn't even start cooking it. Since it was ham, eggs and chips it didn't take long to cook and they gave me a pint on the house and refunded me the meal. Overall, the meal was good. Make sure you order your food at the bar or you will be sitting around for a while.

Its an average pub on a fairly run down boat - don't get me wrong when the sun is shining and you fancy something different than the local beer garden head on down but don't expect anything outstanding. Average central London prices, get ready to depart with £5+ for most drinks available. Fairly grim toilet facilities. All in all good if you want the Thames breeze - if not head back inland.

Well, this is very cheesy London. A boat pub on Thames, with river views of all hot London stuff like the London eye, the south bank and the houses of Parliament. If you are not entirely fed up with that, it is a nice place to have a drink. It has both seating on the open deck as well on the bridge and the inside of the boat below. It is especially pleasant on decent weather around sunset time. You might want to tone down the alcohol consumption, because combined with the swaying of the boat I assume it it will definitely have an unpleasant outcome.
Nice views, service questionable. Decor inside reminiscent of Stansted airport departure lounge, stay on deck.

result.name: Rafayel on the Left Bank
result.address: 34 Lombard Road, London SW11 3RF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This was initially going to be a decent review, as the reason I went was to do a Spa day with my girlfriend for her birthday and that was pretty good.

The Spa was pretty decent, the Spa receptionist was nice and she explained what would happen, sent to the changing rooms, have your treatment then spend all day in the rest of the Spa.

The treatment was good standard I think, not had many, the massage, the bath was constant running water, the Aloe vera juice, when you are done, they come back and collect you.

You can then spend your time in the rest of the Spa, Jacuzzi, Steam, Sauna, Pool. The Steam room was broken when we went, the pool was one of those treatment ones for sports people where you turn it on and go against the current, not exactly relaxing and not exactly big. We didn't stay in this part for more than 20 minutes.

We then sat in a quiet room, to have a bit of food and drink before we left which was quite relaxing.

When we went to leave, there was information about a free shuttle offered, so I asked for that to museum row, the person turned up to take us in their car, chatting to the receptionist about calling him on his personal mobile. There was no taxi information, there was no meter, once we arrived at our destination, he decided it was £25 ... for a 10 minute journey. I asked for a receipt but was told I couldn't have one. I contacted the hotel afterwards to ask for a refund, receipt or explanation, they said that the "taxi" was a third party firm they used. I asked for more information on which one, they said "it could be 1 of 3", so not sure, sorry"

This made me think, they aren't really that trustworthy and aren't of the "make the customer happy" mantra, so I am avoiding this place.

Well Situated hotel, free shuttle from the station, arrived quickly, room was great, clean and comfy bed. Great staff and service.

Restaurant was overpriced for the quality of food received, and spa was lacking a swimming pool. Cant fault anything else, great message treatment received.

Staff locked me out on the roof. I was treated rudely when I informed them, and then they made up stories on Trip Advisor when I gave them a poor review (they do this every time they get a poor review you can see for yourself). Classless organization. Poor customer service. Also, they are much further from the center of London then they lead you to believe. There are much nicer, better quality hotels closer to the sites. And don't even get me started on the "spa." A 1 star pretending to be a 5 star. I have never been treated so poorly by a hotel in my life. You don't expect to be verbally attacked at a 5 star. I have never complained to or written a poor review of a hotel in my entire life. Thanks Rafayel on the Left Bank for ruining my stay!

I came to a private function at this venue and was very pleasantly surprised. Wandsworth riverside is not an area in would expect a 5-star hotel but the food at our event was of a very high standard and the staff were attentive. So if it's convenient for you, have a look.
Illogical name. This is on the right bank (Thames goes West to east, seine east to west)

result.name: The Ivy
result.address: 1-5 West St, London WC2H 9NQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I took my wife there for our anniversary. Classy and comfortable place ideal for special occasions. Very rich menu and impressive wine list. We were very pleased with the service of the polite and qualified staff. We definitely come back to try another speciality from their menu.

Really posh restaurant...very classy...customers service 5 stars.Yes my ghetto self didn't not know half of the menu..but still food was very delicious.. It can be very expensive for the average Joe but there as set menu's for under £30 (3 course) but you tailor ur price really.. plus see celebrities is a plus if you lucky 😜
The food was outstanding and the service fantastic. The place has a great atmosphere to it. It was difficult to get a booking though, recommend calling as far in advance as possible.

My first time at The Ivy. Good service good food. 
Looking forward going there again.

If you can get a member to invite you, definitely worth a visit to ride in the glass lift and explore the different floors of dining rooms. The roof bar is usually quiet so a good place to get some work done, people watch on other floors. Get the pistachio ice cream- it comes with a nougat stick and is absolutely delicious.

result.name: The River Café
result.address: Thames Wharf, Rainville Road, London W6 9HA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: My favourite London restaurant. I had the softest freshest Squid I've ever had there, and the best bottle of Soave I've ever tasted. Expensive but delicious. Perfect place to take your girl for a night out.

Really wonderful Italian restaurant, in a venue with perfect blend of sense of occasion and relaxed atmosphere with incredible location by river Thames. Expensive but delicious. Perfect place to take your parents if they come to London in summer.

A fantastic restaurant in a quiet spot on the river. The staff really take their time to get to know the menu and as a result are very helpful and passionate about the food. For lunch I would recommend a Antipasti and a Primi followed by a dessert! The lemon tart is lovely! We looked at the Secondi which are the mains and they were quite large portions! It really is good, simple, honest Italian food and the best pasta I have had!

I had been looking forward to the River Cafe for ages (lots of my friends raved about it) but I thought it was under-whelming. Our starters (eg, the crab) were distinctly average - certainly not worth the £20 - and the main courses pretty much the same. We had fish dishes that would have been respectable in an average British pub but would have cost a third of what we paid. Likewise, the desserts were unimpressive. On the plus side, the sommelier's choice of wine was good. Service was pleasant but unexceptional.

The restaurant has a lovely setting, a nice buzz and is good for people watching but definitely a much over-priced and over-rated restaurant. Definitely won't be back.
Best italian reataurant in London

result.name: Rules
result.address: 34-35 Maiden Lane, London WC2E 7LB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
It is a fancy restaurant. I always wanted to visit this place. Sometimes we need exciting experiences, don't we?
Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive. He politely asked us a couple of times: Is everything ok? or Do we need of something else? He recommended us many dishes. We could not resist the temptation and decided to order two pieces of their fabulous Moist Chocolate & Hazelnut Cake! 
 I just have no words. Fascinating place with unique menu. Exceeded all my expectations!

Good Afternoon Colin, In this case I have reported the incident in good faith and have been very disappointed, firstly the theft itself and then again with both your responses, via telephone and email.

I find incredible statements such as "we can't just pay everyone who makes such allegations", and "the theft happened against you so its your responsibility to report it to the police".

You are passing on to your patrons the responsibility of repairing the damage caused by rogue staff that you have employed, who conducted Gross Misconduct whilst in your employment and towards your patrons. Clearly this will not end well for your reputation and more to the point if you have a rogue member of staff stealing petty items from the general public you can be assured that they will also be stealing other items from your company (I wont be the first nor the last).

I do not have time to report to the police such an incident nor do I have the desire to get involved with an ongoing investigation on your behalf. I have explained that I am leaving the country on the 15th and will be in Argentina for the next 5 months. Further to suggest I should wait for the insurance to pay you out before I get any form of recompense is also despicable. 

I have reported this incident without making any claims for compensation, thats not to say I would not have accepted such in good faith, but when such incidents occur, it is our responsibility to report these to the management else nothing will be done and that person will continue doing to others and yourselves. When you find that an opportunist crime has taken place involving your own money and own staff you will NOT be able to say "I had no idea our staff were committing such crimes", we have informed you and I hope that happens sooner rather than later given your apathy in our case.

Kind regards

A classic, British restaurant, Rules is a lovely place for a celebratory dinner. It feels really festive and has a certain class.
Serves British food - my fave is the fish and chips and they have a great cocktail menu too!

This restaurant offer tasty meals at fair price. In my opinion, this is not a place where you can spend a little because of its good quality food and services. Lovely atmosphere, great food and worth the money spent. I will go back for some more.

My fiance and I are really fond of travelling, exploring places and all other adventures and last week we visited Rules Restaurant. The food here was really great. Dina enjoyed the fresh food and warm service. The drinks selection was also good!

result.name: Hilton London Metropole Hotel
result.address: 225 Edgware Road, London W2 1JU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Looks awful on the outside but this hotel is actually rather nice on the inside. Pretty standard city centre Hilton, but the conference centre in here is well equipped and versatile, which makes it a very popular venue for smaller trade shows and larger business meetings. If you're visiting London and this place is in your budget, then it's an ideal hotel for being close to the city centre but not so close that you feel boxed in.

Paddington train and tubes are a quick (albeit confusing) walk and the two flavours of Edgware Road station are easy as well. You might have to cross the road a baffling number of times to get to them though.

I was at this hotel for one week, I already requested to provide smoking room to me , but at checking time , one of the reception staff told me that is not available at this moment and also they provide me my room at 16:00 , Normally hotel check in was also at 15:00 , that means 1 hour later than normal check in time in worldwide .

I smoked in my room for 1 time and next morning they charged me 100 POUNDS without any notice or warning . after this problem , they provide me the crazy room as Deluxe room , but unfortunately their deluxe room was scandal and so dirty in bathroom and so much smaller than my normal room .

For breakfast time also every time you will wait n Q for around 15 Min and specially more than this on Saturday and sunday .

My suggestion is DO NOT CHOOSE this hotel in london anymore .

My parents used to stay at this hotel when they come to visit me in london.Just an advice for the future customers.I rent a car in the green motion which is situated inside the hotel.They have been stealing from me.I rent a car for 2 days and they make me paid 1800 pounds.An advice never rent from them.When you go and ask the reception they will tell you to go and rent from them but don't make this mistake.Its look like hilton is ok to support these kind of business inside their hotel.Its a shame because I will never let my parents stayed to this hilton again.

Nice hotel but was very unimpressed with the mix up with our luggage. A porter came to our room and kindly took our cases and bags to the storage room for the day so we could have a few hours in London before our train home. He took the trolley straight into the storage room and came out with a ticket for 6 items. We returned a few hours later to catch a taxi to the station and they kindly offered to load our bags into the taxi after we had collected them. It was not until we got to the train station did we realise that a rucksack with my daughters ipad in was not with us. With only a few minutes until our train my husband had to dash back, only to be told that we gave in six bags and six were collected. We very naively trusted the porter to take those bags straight into the storage room while we waited in a queue for our ticket and did not count the exact number of bags(a lesson!!) Eventually my husband got the rucksack back but we missed our train and incurred extra charges. I explained this to the head of luggage and he said, "sorry!"
It was a lovely hotel with an amazing breakfast buffet; only wish I could have stayed longer!

result.name: 100 Club
result.address: 100 Oxford Street, London W1D 1LL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Simply fantastic. The 100 Club is an iconic venue, trurly one of London's music scene landmarks that's worth to be mentioned; the place is drenched with history thanks to almost half a century of countless bands and artists that graced its tiny stage; along with the Ronnie Scott's, this is the only historical venue in the very heart of London to have survived to this date unlike my beloved Marquee Club, The Astoria and other fantastic places that deserved to be rescued and kept alive as national treasures; at the 100 Club don't expect great service, huge variety of drinks, vanilla-scented lavatories of whatsoever frills, this place is Rock and Roll..!!! Sticky floors, sweaty walls and motley crowd; if you like party atmosphere, good vibes and real live music, this is the place for you.
Great music venue, but very expensive bar. Nice and central location.
Dismal. They've refurbished the entrance but stopped at the point you can't see from the street. A real grot box.

I have come with some friends here for a couple of drinks! The place is nice! It was a bit crowded the night we visited but there were lots of pretty girls! I am overall glad to come here every now and again!

I wanted to go to the somehow famous 100 Club for some time already, but for some reason I've never made it there. Now, finally, I was there. Not strictly for a music event, but for some mix between poetry and music. Anyway, the venue seems really okay, just the toilets are a bit shit. 

It wasn't too crowded on that Sunday evening, so it was really fine. Only the air con made it horribly cold at one point. But perhaps that's just me, and when there are more people, I'm sure you're grateful for a powerful air con. 

All in all, 100 Club seems to me to be quite a good concert venue.

result.name: Institute Of Contemporary Arts
result.address: The Mall, London SW1Y 5AH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Stylish art venue. Has a good bar/cafe. Great theatre and cinema showing movies from across the world.

I think everyone can find something for themselves, as the array of books, exhibitions and films can cater to different tastes and interpretations. Besides, you can meet and mingle with like-minded people, share ideas and experiences and learn and grow, finding new and exciting events to provoke your mind and inspire you.

Discover something new in art, film or books and lose yourself in the fabulous books on offer, drink in the bar or mingle with other like minded people in this hidden away haven in London. I'm glad to say it is still here after all these years and making a revival with member deals and film previews and discussions and talks on Friday lunchtimes. I remember going to bohemian exhibitions and even an album launch party and socialising with all the musicians as the venue can be hired privately for celebrations and have come back to rediscover its magic once again. I recommend you come and see what it has to offer you!

I came here to see The Punk Singer in the ICA cinema, a perfect venue for this film. A pretty small cinema but intimate enough for independent films. The box office/shop area is a bit manic just before the films are about to start but the queues go down quickly. Really love this venue, great atmosphere.

Modest, unassuming, hidden, but special. For many, many years.
Listened to Pete Rugolo, music arranger to the great Stan Kenton, there in the mid-1960s.

result.name: O2 Academy Islington
result.address: N1 Centre, 16 Parkfield Street, Islington N1 0PS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: While being forced to smoke outside I was the victim of a horrific rape which lasted for well over 10 minutes. The worst thing about it was I never got his phone number. Inside the venue I could not hear anything other than loud music coming from the direction of the stage, what the hell was that all about? Anyway while in the men's toilet I was raped again by another male, this time a black. I did not move or call out during the ordeal as I was told that black people have weak eyes and if you don't move they will not be able to see you. This turned out to not be true and I was left bruised and erect for days and every visit to the toilet would have me leaving a jizzy shit behind. Over all 8.5/ 10. Great time was had.

Great place, reasonable drinks and a good university feel for Friday and Saturday club nights. They have a couple of rooms and when bands play the atmosphere is really intimate. Propaganda on a Friday night is a good laugh with current indie music featuring heavily, and Saturday night is primarily cheese - like a student union!

I have only good memories of the O2 Academy Islington.

Here I went to see great artists and bands like: Goldfinger, Zebrahead, Mc Lars and many others.

Place is quite small, it can probably host 200-300 people top, but that's not too bad as it allows you to stay very close to your favourite artists if you want.

Here I also got a drumstick from the Goldfinger drummer and met MC Lars.

Terrible staff, great venue. Went to see Sebastian bach, didn't even get to see him as I was thrown out by a member of staff for stepping on a woman's toe. Staff are very hostile and rude. I'd avoid it going back there

Neat venue, good size and atmosphere. Saw VNV Nation here in 2013 and had a great time. Phoned up for information on the day of the gig and after navigating a maze of phone menus found the staff to be very helpful after all.

Drinks were a bit pricey but hey, it's London what do you expect?

Upper balcony/bar area worked as a great refuge from the gig when tired and the crowd (at capacity) was a great size, not too scary and not too small.

I'd recommend this place in general though having my water and glowsticks confiscated at the entrance was rather annoying.

result.name: Callooh Callay
result.address: 65 Rivington St, London EC2A 3AY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This place is Quirky and fun the menu comes in a Oyster card holder and really plays on the kids at heart. To get to the loos you go through a wardrobe! The staff are friendly the atmosphere it's really relaxed, they bring round water to make sure your drinking responsibly. It's just a great little bar for a date or taking friends everyone I've taken there have loved it and you will to!

Cracking cocktails with incredibly friendly staff who are all too ready to help you jump down the rabbit hole of delicious drinks. The menu is full of incredibly eccentric and mouthwatering gold cocktails that will leave you struggling to decide what you want to drink. The drinks are served in some sort of unique glass, too and the atmosphere just oozes coolness. If you want to come across trendy and in the know, take your friends to here
Best cocktails ever, really interesting bar inside and very cool. Staff all very friendly and service pretty quick.
The Kilner Me Softly cocktail is excellent. Quirky wardrobe is like going into Narnia. Love the attentive staff, even if they're a bit too attentive to take your money!

A top cocktail spot in Shoreditch. Impressive cocktail list, which are strong but quite expensive. Nice intimate venue so good for a catch up with a friend or a first date. Book a table before hand to make sure you get a spot in the back bar through the wardrobe.

result.name: Sofitel London St James
result.address: 6 Waterloo Place, London SW1Y 4AN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: if you like indian food please Try The Taj Restaurant in 10 Carlton Parade Orpington Kent BR6 0JB open 7 days a week Monday to Saturday 5.30pm to 11.30pm and Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm

We used the Spa recently and it was one of the best Spa experiences I've had. The staff were very friendly, helpful and knew exactly what they were doing. This might be a little bit more expensive than some other Spas, but the small additional cost gets you a a fabulous experience. I would strongly recommend going to this spa, I know i will be returning in the future.

Really friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are very clean. And the shower was so wonderful! The hotel is very expensive, but defiantly worth it. You should not plan to get drunk in the bar, because it will cost you a fortune.. We also have to mention the Amazingly good bed. Its heaven on earth.
What a fantastic day I had for my birthday. I cant thank you enough for the excellent food, wine and service, we all had a " ball"

I tried Sofitel Rose room for the afternoon tea. I liked it so much that I returned back again. The place has amazing charm, with live harpist, nice English rose decorations in the room. It is small enough to create a private experience of the true english afternoon tea. Tea, scones and cakes are delicious and once I am planning to return again.

result.name: One Aldwych Hotel
result.address: 1 Aldwych, London WC2B 4BZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: if you like indian food please Try The Taj Restaurant in 10 Carlton Parade Orpington Kent BR6 0JB open 7 days a week Monday to Saturday 5.30pm to 11.30pm and Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm

My wife and I completely enjoyed our 6 night stay at One Aldwych. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. Our room was clean and well appointed. The Lobby Bar was one of the highlights of our trip; they elevate bar tending to an art form. Don't miss out on the Charlie and the Chocolate Factory tea. Highly recommend this hotel.

Came here for the Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Afternoon Tea. It was nice, but not quite up to the standard of others I've had elsewhere. The candyfloss and cocoa bean financiers were fantastic though! The outside of the hotel is unremarkable, but it is beautiful inside. The service was exceptional. I would definitely return.

I went here for their Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Afternoon Tea and enjoyed the experience so much that I returned just a few weeks later!

The afternoon tea itself was incredible and I enjoyed every single second of it, coming out of there feeling truly sick where I'd overindulged! 

The venue is easy to get to and very attractively designed and the staff were extremely attentive without seeming like they were staring at you the whole time. I have a nut allergy and they went above and beyond, providing me with a cake that wasn't even listed on their menu to make up for the one I couldn't eat. Can't find a single fault with the whole experience!

Went in for a Charlie and The Chocolate Factory tea which was gorgeous. Was promised a prize for guessing the flavour of the candy floss. Gave up waiting after 15 minutes as I had a play to see.

The food and the service was lovely. The waiters/waitresses were very friendly.

result.name: Skylon
result.address: Royal Festival Hall, Belvedere Road, London SE1 8XX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
If you have the option, book a table at the window, you won't be disappointed. Fifth star was for the extraordinary service at the fine dining part of the restaurant. We were tired so took an easy option of ordering a set menu of two courses and a bottle of wine, after much deliberation. When the wine arrived, I had to unfortunately discuss with the our garzón as it was slightly corked, which they promptly accepted and opened another bottle to taste, which was indeed better. 

Through out the whole evening we received excellent service and recommendation to enhance our experience of being there. The Large open bar in the middle and view of thames at night all add up to the ambience. You feel like you are among the élite as the hustle and bustle in the busy side of the restaurant all add up, yet you can comfortably have a decent and private conversation in these comfy chairs. Perhaps its the high ceilings that prevents the other sounds over powering your own voice. 

Its a great place to have a glass of wine, while watching London go buy on the river. If you can get here before sunset, its a definite worthwhile transition to the evening there are seats around the bar area if you don't want to be sitting down for dinner. 

But be warned, its a heavy foot traffic area, so either book in advance or go there early, you will find affluent tourists, performers, organisers of South Bank Events, to City Londoners socialising here, though, its hardly ever empty, but when you look outside those windows, it will be just you and the rest of the world,.. and of course that drink on your hand.

We chose to come to the restaurant for my friend's special birthday and was very disappointed. The waiters and service were very good unfortunately the food is tastetless and over priced. I ordered from the theatre menu and had pumkin soup for starters which was fairly ok rather standard not even a little garnish. For main my friend had duck from the al carte menu and I had pork with a dollop of sloppy mash, both were nothing special I have had much better in cheaper restaurants. I was so put off I decided against having a third course. We had intended to dine out splash some cash but did not get good value for money. The champage was good as was the wine even though we were given a dearer wine then the one we had asked for, we didn't complain because we wanted to have a nice evening. As a whole this was a poor dining experience and I'm afraid the view did not compensate. I felt bad that I did not pay the full service charge because it wasn't the waiters fault only the kitchen's, however I made that call because It's not possible to deduct from the bill. The kitchen is seriously lacking and is letting the side down!

When I visited this restaurant for the first time, I truly enjoyed my Sunday lunch. Very pleasant atmosphere and excellent service. The member of staff were good-natured and they have created welcoming ambience. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to taste good food and high quality wine.

Perfect for chilled out Sunday afternoon cocktails - amazing views of the South Bank. Staff where welcoming and immaculately dressed (designer uniforms I'm reliably informed). 

Didn't stay for food but get the impression it would be an experience... Next time
Fine dining at its best. Service and attention to detail in here is superior to anywhere else I've visited. Very buzzy atmosphere and also a good bar for pre dinner drinks.

result.name: Nobu
result.address: 15 Berkeley Street, London W1J 8DY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Amazing Experience. Wonderful Food! I was made to feel truly special! Can't wait to go back.

I am a Nobu fan. I have eaten at Nobu from Moscow to Malibu. But Berkeley Street was a shocking disappointment.

As I was solo this visit, the hostess beckoned me to my seat at the edge of the sushi bar. I was not keen for the seat as I was flanked on my left by a woman, half of whose body jetted into my space as she flirted desperately with her date. To my right was a series of bottles protruding from the wall, the effect of which was a medieval iron maiden, where the necks seemed like spikes into my right arm. Pay no heed I told myself; the fish would be good, and I would soon lay my sake-infused jet-lagged cranium on my soft hotel pillow.

Without a thought I asked my waiter for a sashimi plate and an order of oshinko. But I requested that the chef hold off on the tuna and the salmon. The waiter proclaimed that they would instead charge me a la carte as apparently 6 of the 14 pieces needed be tuna and salmon for the 39 quid sashimi plate. I protested, stating that menu carried a disclaimer that tuna could be substituted. He retorted that the waiver related only to bluefin tuna for environmental reasons. I said, 'whatever', but if he brought me either I wouldn't eat it.

Within 5 minutes a chef - who had twice wiped his brow with his hand and rubbed his face with his sleeve all the while handling my raw foods - set a plate in front of my hungry eyes: hamachi, mackerel, snapper, a scallop, two pieces of scampi and of course tuna. I told the chef I didn't want tuna; he said, 'You said no bluefin tuna.'. He didn't wipe his brow at least.

Hungry and impatient already, I ate. The hamachi was icy, and the scallops were rubbery. True, normally they are rubbery, but these were downright gumby-ish. All of the pieces were cold, like refrigerator cold. Roughly five minutes later, the rice came. Rather than a mellow blend, hot and moist, the rice tasted as if it had been microwaved. Dry and kernel-like, it would barely be eaten.

All that remained of my plate were the three pieces of tuna. The waiter then came to refill my water and asked how things were. I stated the truth in four-letter words, adding that the tuna looked as if it had been taken out of a can. A dull shade of red, lacking that deep semi-iridescent look, the tuna did seem as if it came anywhere but from the fish monger.

Roughly 8-10 min later, the oshinko came, but by this point, I was hardly in the mood to savor one of my favorite treats. I chugged the remaining bit of sake (which was excellent btw), slurped my remaining pickles and asked for the check.

Upon departure, I did ask the hostess how to make a complaint. Unwilling to assist me - or understand me, she passed me on to another waiter, who apologized for the fact that the manager was entertaining a client. He tried to take notes, but I knew he was powerless. So I take to Google to warn people of the sashimi plate, an unimaginative blend of meager fish, a collection one piece of octopus short of the set meal at the food court in Minneapolis rather than a Nobu on one of the more exclusive streets in London.

Go for the hot food. Go for the sake. Expect to be belittled. Don't go alone. And avoid anything, upon which the chef may either inflict his unclean hands or utter lack of originality.
Having heard so much about Nobu, I was expecting a lot more. I found the set menu at Zuma to be much better. Overall the food and service was good. I liked the bar more than the restaurant.

Me and my family had amazing dinner at Nobu. The food was perfectly cooked and served. Sushi usually is not "my cup of tea", but this one, that I ordered last night, was really tasty. Very nice atmosphere and flawless service.
Family favourite, have been so many times I could probably recite the menu. Informal atmosphere. Will continue to go back.

result.name: The Wolseley
result.address: 160 Piccadilly, London W1J 9EB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
So my friend just popped back for a week from Hong Kong and she was raving on about the cheesecake from this place. We scheduled a last minute meeting for tea here, although we did try to book first. My friend was told that it was fully reserved but we can try to walk in.

Lo and behold, counting our lucky stars, when we walked in at 430pm on a Saturday they found a spare table which they need back at 6pm for dinner, and we thought why not, 1.5 hours are quite sufficient for tea, so we were seated.

The decor of the place is pretty grand but you are not charged extortionate prices for the pleasure, which was of course, very pleasurable ;) I opted for a cream tea which consisted of 3 scones with the normal clotted cream and strawberry jam and went for Darjeeling tea, and my friend asked for Earl Gray with a slice of cheese cake.

The food was good but nothing spectacular. While I thought the cheese cake tasted pretty average, maybe excelling at being more smooth in texture than usual, I wouldn't really say this is a thing to die for. The scones were also pretty much what one would expect, although I really appreciate the place giving me plenty of clotted cream and jam to slather generously over my scones. Nothing like not enough toppings to go around to spoil your mood right?

I have had a look at the afternoon tea which includes the sandwiches and also other desserts, but it didn't really strike me as that much more fanciful than other high tea places. Now if they were doing super cute themes like in the Landau (i.e. Valentines theme, Fashion week themed cakes/desserts), I would be more tempted to give this more stars. Service is good, the decor is good, the food is so so, therefore this place gets a 4 stars from me!

Really disappointed with the whole experience. Inattentive staff - many of them wandering around aimlessly chatting and joking with other staff. The sandwiches were too cold and the cucumber one was saturated with so much mint! Cakes were much better. We had to ask for more tea, then they forgot about us!! The waiter who had taken our cups, when she brought them back she missed one of us out! And, the restaurant was not fully booked- god only knows how you cope then!

Also, can someone explain why in this day and age silver tea pots with handles that are far too hot to hold are served I really don't know. The least the waiter could have done was make us aware of the hot handles instead my daughter screeched when she touched it!!

We went to the Wolseley as it was recommended in one of the Sunday magazines and my daughter treated me, as it was a pre birthday outing, and the rest of the family. 

It would be good to hear from someone from the Wolseley as I feel if Gordon Ramsey visited the place he would shut it down - inefficient, staff in need of basic training and incompetent. What a pity.

The place to go for a special breakfast in glamorous surroundings. The friendly Scottish waiter who attended us really made us feel welcome. Before arriving I was worried it might be quite snooty but our waiter put us at ease. Efficient and friendly service that is hard to come by in other places. I felt very relaxed in there and the food was absolutely delicious. I'll definitely be going back.

I've been many a time and always raved about the place. Yesterday the illusion was somewhat shattered. Pancakes and rancid butter isn't the ideal combination for breakfast. 

We complained and were told that the Chefs standard were upheld. A simple sniff test would have done the trick. I suspect that as we were walk-in they couldn't give a toss. 

#wolseley #thewolseley
Very nice atmosphere, food and service! Like it a lot. Had our breakfast here.

result.name: The Tower Hotel
result.address: Saint Katharine's Way, London E1W 1LD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
If your going to stay here then you have to purchase the room with a view of Tower Bridge. The windows are designed to maximise your view, going across the whole of the wall which makes it even better. 

The hotel staff were welcoming and friendly and even though I was given the wrong room originally to what I had booked, this was quickly sorted with just one phone call down to reception made. 

The hotel does have free wifi but I found it cut out a lot. 

Beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows, room was clean with 2 nice chairs to relax in and bathroom was clean and presentable with lots of towels. 

A little tip - Booking in advance isn't always the cheaper option

Great customer service. Free WiFi - 'WiFi is not a luxury, it is a necessity'. Fantastic breakfast. After deciding to stay longer, we needed to change rooms, the second room was a little more disappointing, very dim lighting and broken safe. However the first room was delightful.
The staff was very friendly and had a fantastic breakfast with a lot of choices. The room was clean and very confortable. The view from our room was the amazing Katharine Docks

I was really impressed with the efficiency during check in and breakfast....Breakfast was delicious with a wide variety to choose from, we checked out and had our luggage stored for us until we were ready to leave London which was a plus for us with all the shopping we had done over the weekend....overall a wonderful experience that I would treasure for a lifetime.
Friendly staff, clean room, comfy beds, good amenities and free wifi. Enjoyed staying here and loved the view of the Tower Bridge from our room.

result.name: The Hand & Flowers
