result.address: 126 West Street, Marlow, Buckinghamshire SL7 2BP, United Kingdom

result.name: Café de Paris
result.address: 3 Coventry Street, London W1D 6BL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This glamorous venue puts on a pretty good variety cabaret. We sat in the gallery and shared a table with two lovely couples; the atmosphere was wonderfully conducive to friendliness and we had a great time together. The members of staff had a genuinely nice air about them and seemed to enjoy working there, which makes all the difference.

My only reservation is that I did feel the cabaret was a LITTLE lacking. I would have preferred a tad more female input. Only the showgirl dancers represented female talent.

It is an amazing place and I am interested in going to see the Cabaret, the music was incredible the whole night, from old school songs to the newbies I knew every song! I understand that it is based in central London so prices are going to be high, but £14 for a Double Vodka and lemonade seems a little pricey when its only £7 for a single!
Also at first we was discussing whether to have the table but we decided for how much it worked out for us to pay we would rather stay on the dance floor, which then we was made to re-pay our entry fee even though we had already paid once, so it cost the girls £20 to get in the end each and the boys £40! 
Amazing place and had a really good night but found the money situation a little ridiculous in the end!

Dreadful experience. Despite paying an over priced entrance, and an additional £900 for a friends birthday to be celebrated- we were given a lot of attitude by staff, especially bouncers. They refused our entry and when asked why, they angrily replied 'we legally don't have to give you a reason to allow you back in'. I would understand if I had been drunk, or even slightly wobbly- but I was neither. There was no justification for the way their bouncers had treated my friends and I. The birthday girl was told to 'wait outside for 15 minutes to cool down'. She also had not been tipsy and was not given any reasoning as to why she was told to wait outside. Strongly recommend you do not waste your time or money here.

Me and a few girls were lining up to go in because it was her birthday they seemed like they were in a rush to get us in? Within 2 minutes we were told to step out of the queue? There were 7 of us and we had some serious money to spend! We just wanted to have a good time. Anyways we were dressed appropriately so the only other conclusion is they are RACIST! All of us were black girls but we did not think that would be an issue? Seriously don't even bother going if your black, you will just get embarrassed. Thanks a lot Cafe de Paris for making us feel like were back in slavery days!

Café de Paris is an atypical club, it looks like a cabaret and the atmosphere is great! 
I went on a Saturday night with friends, we book a table through LuxGuestList and we were treated like VIPs. 
Performers enliven the party and the atmosphere becomes hot. 
I highly recommend it :)

result.name: Bob Bob Ricard
result.address: 1 Upper James Street, London W1F 9DF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This Soho restaurant is both kitch and elegant. It's got a Great Gatsby feel of decadence and you can just picture glamorous couples sipping champagne and eating caviar back in the day. It's know for THE champagne button at each booth which is a little gimmicky but quite fun too. I was lucky enough to press it and we enjoyed some lovely champagne with our meal. It's a great place for an occasion and if you've got a sweet tooth don't miss the Signature Chocolate Glory.

I have to say I have never written a restaurant review in my life, bad or good. However after vising Bob Bob Ricard last night I had to! The restaurant itself gorgeous, the atmosphere great, the staff happy, smiley & attentive, the food and cocktails delicious! I would urge anyone to go, fantastic place. I will definitely be coming back :)

My friends and I had an amazing night. We simply loved the club room. I've tasted Russian traditional vodka for the first time. Well, it was not my cup of tea, but the others liked it.The staff was very polite and organised. Next time we will book a table at the restaurant in order to try something from their amazing menu.

The excitement of eating at this beautiful decorated and inspired restaurant was not wasted. Arriving half an hour early we were greeted with smiles and were seated at our table right away, even though I was expecting to wait at the bar. Every member of staff were attentive, jolly and made you feel at home right from the moment we walked through the door. 

The food was just as mesmerising as the decor. The Lobster Pelmeni were elegantly served and melted in the mouth. The sweetness of the lobster and salmon roe delicately complimented one another with bursts of flavour and texture. My partners Zakuski taster plate was just as delicate. Not being a fan of Russian Olivier salad, I was happy to let him enjoy his favourite dish. Which I have been informed was better than his mothers. Best we keep that under our hats. 

For the main I ordered the Fillet Mignon Rosini and yet again I was not disappointed. The aged beef fillet packed in loads of flavour, which held a certain sweetness against the seared melt in the mouth foie gras and refreshing morsels of apple. Although the fillet was exceptional, the crispy pork belly won hands down. The Suckling Pork Belly was a superb balance of flavours which left your mouth watering and demanding you order another plate to wash down the first helping.

Our deserts were just as glamorous as well s comforting. The trio of crème brulees were small but deadly, the sweetness of each were a divine, light and refreshing way to end the meal. My dish however, was certainly heavy and rich. The Bob Bob Ricard Signature Chocolate Glory was in anything theatrical and spectacular. Being the woman that I am, who loves all things chocolate was mesmerised by the beauty of the dish but found it hard to it and felt it needed just a little something extra to cut through the richness of the chocolate mouse an was thankful for the little cube of treasure that was the passion fruit and orange jelly.

Overall I was extremely happy to have experienced the eccentricity and humble food (with a twist) of Bob Bob Ricard. I can not wait to return and try more of thee menu, although it certainly would be nice to see a few more Russian dishes make an appearance on the menu in the future though. 

As I said before, the staff were amazing making sure our glasses were constantly topped up, that our every whim and need was not only catered for but genuinely cared about. Not once did they rush us to eat in order to seat the next guests but gave us time to enjoy our food and each others company in a warm atmospheric environment. 

I have to say the measly 12.5% service charge added to the bill certainly wasn't enough to show our appreciation of our time here and should be doubled for the amount of effort and grace displayed by each member of staff.
Press for champagne button service is not enough. You must try their champagne chicken pie! But the lobster macaroni was alright. It was a Russian British classy dining place.

result.name: Butler's Wharf Chop House
result.address: 36E Shad Thames, London SE1 2YE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I really want to give this place more stars than just average but can't. 

The restaurant is very busy which is to be expected considering it's location. Most of the other tables are white noise but being in the City, some people just have to make themselves heard like the "property developers" (aka estate agents) who have to enquire into HMO for all their new properties. Nothing that the restaurant itself is at fault for but to be aware of when you decide to dine in such a prime location. 

The wine menu at first glance looks extensive but when after asking I was informed that the small x's next to over half the list meant they were out of stock, it soon dwindled. 

The food is nice. It's decent (duck patè to start, steak for main with a side of chips and sticky toffee pudding for desert). It's nice because it's nice. It's decent because of the City prices you are paying for the food. 

What saved this place for me is the attentive staff who were friendly but not too over beating and the views however I won't be rushing back anytime soon.

We organised a business meeting here. Everything was flawless thanks to the waiting staff that created welcoming ambience. The dishes were carefully prepared and served. The wine was well worth tasting. Next meeting definitely will be held at the same place.
If you want to develop a taste for the British cuisine, then this is the right place! You just have to try the steak and kidney pudding, it's outstanding.

Gloriously sunny evening so chose the Chop House for supper to take advantage of al fresco dining with a superb view. The starers of smoked salmon and potted shrimps were both OK. For main courses the battered fish and chips was good but the roast beef with Yorkshires and roast potatoes a big disappointment. No wine or coffee, just a few beers and water brought the bill close to £100 which seemed expensive – but I suppose that’s what you have to pay for the view – where else can you see Tower Bridge, the Gherkin, the Cheesegrater and the Walkie Talkie in one glance? Our waitress (only her third day at this restaurant) was friendly and efficient but the service could have been speedier – although we were seated just after a large party (10/12?) which slowed things down somewhat.
Two of the best soups I've ever had were had here. They had a mushroom soup and a pea soup I tried on separate visits. Just spectacular. The view and service were good as well.

result.name: Tiger Tiger London
result.address: 29 Haymarket, London SW1Y 4SP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
-Cheaters-

Well 
My friend had a birthday party there
He suggested me to buy a ticket online for the "VIP" or "Guest" or call it whatever you like list and avoid the queue,and I did it.
Once in the website this is what they write on it : """Tiger Tiger London is giving you the chance to cheat your way to the front of the queue!"""
Bought my ticket so I'm sure that after my 10 hours shift at work I can get straight in, and cheer my friend.
Well once in the entrance door I spoke to the security guys asking them what to do for get in and showing them that I have bought the ticket
They didn't give a s**a about that and sent me queueing
I'd told them that in the website is write that you get in straight with the ticket,and them answered: if you want in, then queue 
Not in the right mode to fight I took the queue,once back to the main door the security guy asked my ID, looking at it he asked why I'm alone ""What??"" I'm in a prison o are you just kidding me..
Me : No I'm not alone,my friends are in
Security : Are you sure
Me : yes sure
Security : Where are they
Me : WHAT???????
Security : Call them

Well at that moment I hardly keep myself calm
Tried to explain him that in that mess I would never hear my phone,and my friend is not phone addicted, as mainly people are.
Nothing to do, he putted me out! and told me to call my friend out!!!
After 10 minutes I was able to bring him out
Once inside the ""internal"" security, "doorladies" asked me £15 to get in!!!!!! 
I was getting mad!
Showed her my ticket and my friend told her I'm in the guest list ,
well....nothing to do, she sent me out.
After the security start argue eachother and let me in
I don't wanna write even about the service,cos I think there is no point...
Bought one beer £5.30 and one gin tonic £11.80

But if you want free tap water ask to the bar as wrote on the mirror behind the bar

...I'm used to deal with customers day and night and this is not the way to do business guys

This is pickpocket

Nice Music and that is all, over priced at the entrance £15 after 11pm, you then need to pay £2 in cash only for the cloak room, and off course drinks, so a 2 glasses of coke and JD is £22, anyhow its very hot inside, packed with people (stinky sweaty people) and you will have a terrible experience, I recommend you to AVOID. Security guards are nice and the staff but not worth it.

Tiger Tiger London it is a well-known party venue place in the city. The club is located in Haymarket Street close to Piccadilly Circus tube station. It is highly recommended to enter before 9pm due to the entrance is free. In addition, this will make you avoid the big queues outside. The club is divided in 6 different spaces: The Tiger bar, The Tiger Grill, The Cloud Lounge, The Groovy Wonderland, The White room and The Opal bar. You will find a different music style in any of these rooms, so there is a huge music choice for everybody. It is a good option to pre-book a table if you are a big group due to you will have some extra benefits in alcohol and food packages. Drinks are bit expensive so it is recommendable to go there for the happy hour (normally from 5pm to 8pm). Apart from that it is a classic club on the Londoners’ night which is worthy to visit.

Rubbish venue which only seeks to make as much money as they can!

Refuse to let you put your bag down on chairs or jacket making you go to the cloakroom just so they can make some extra money from you. As if charging what they charge for drinks isnt enough!!

Has gone considerably down hill in the last few years. Will not be returning.
Lots of dance floors and well managed. I enjoy this place and would go given the opportunity everytime.

result.name: Ministry of Sound
result.address: 103 Gaunt Street, London SE1 6DP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
MoS is an institution. It attracts many of the top old-skool DJs (Ferry Corsten, Erick Morillo, Paul Oakenfold, Paul van Dyk, Roger Sanchez, etc) despite it being a relatively small venue.

Over the years, the DJs that headline Vegas don’t play here anymore, but it’s still a great venue for last minute club nights. It’s got a good sized outdoor area for eating and smoking (not really my flavour). But all the same, it’s good if you need some “fresh air” and for a chat or as a meeting point… 

On Fridays, the main room is The Gallery and on Saturdays, it’s The Box. There’s also Baby Box – I’m guessing it’s where you can chill, but honestly I am always in The Box, so I really would know. You can get free membership at The Gallery and paid membership for The Box. Membership gives you a small discount and some other perks.

The cloakroom is quick as is the bar – but beware, two cocktails will set you back about £17+! I say, don’t drink there or drink beforehand! The crowd is also really respectful – just go!

If you like white people on drugs, sweaty black people, and a claustrophobic environment make sure you come here. Hell why not, you may as well also get punched in the face for the fun of it. But thats ok, because you can treat yourself to an expensive drink or a random hotdog stall outside.
Woo go ministry
If you like EDM its the best place to be. Amazing sound system and a good line up of artists every weekend.
Sweet clud & I play there come chechit out x

Among the popular clubs in the town this one has the best sound. But the reason people visit Ministry of Sound is the spirit of the place I guess. The bass is awesome and the DJ’s that play here know the meaning of good music.

result.name: The Capital
result.address: 22-24 Basil Street, London SW3 1AT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Absolutely love this hotel, a discreet, elegant and classic hotel in the heart of Knightsbridge. The restaurant is amazing and offers a great value set lunch menu, and the Sitting Room is a perfect place to relax for Afternoon Tea post shopping! They also have a lovely little bar. Cannot recommend highly enough, my favourite hotel in London!

The hotel is modern and up-to-date, very classy and elegant, with a fabulous bar and restaurant. The quality of the rooms was really good and worth for the price. I really love the foods. Very decent and good to taste. Every portion is just enough to feed your craving.

We headed there for the set lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it, especially the soup with was one of their signature dishes. The mains were sizeable, especially for fish and we took great delight in polishing it off. Desert was pleasant though not quite so unique. Sign up for the Grub Club membership for 10% off and we visited
on Thursday when you can BYO wine!
Amzing
This is definitely the WORST hotel I have been to. The rooms are annoyingly small, the furniture is extremely old (not in a nice classical way) and the bathrooms are just sad.

result.name: The Roxy
result.address: 3 Rathbone Place, London W1T 1HJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Had an awful experience last night in which rude and aggressive bouncers refused us entry with for 'being too drunk' despite not having drunk that evening. Having queued outside for over half an hour, with other people in the queue being approached for being too drunk and sent away we were allowed up to the door and then immediately turned away by 'Damian' who could give us no justified reason, was smug, smirking and rude towards us (a group of young female professionals). 'Damian' refused to give us his name and was purposefully blocking his ID card from view so we couldn't obtain his details. After having asked for the manager we were then made to wait for another half an hour outside in the cold before she was able to see us. 'Beth' (manager) agreed that we were not too drunk to enter but despite this still wouldn't allow us inside (again with no due reason), it was also only due to her arrival that 'Damian' would give his name.

Today we phoned the venue and spoke to the general manager 'Simon' who was quiet possibly the worst manager I have ever dealt with. He repeated told us it was probably our fault for either (listing repeatedly) 1. No ID, 2. Being too drunk, 3. Having been barred and refused to even consider our side of the case. He repeatedly said "well what do you want me to do about it?", he refused to make any form of contact with the door staff or manager from the evening,he kept interrupting and attempting to blame us for last nights discourses and made numerous assumptions as to our behavior, insinuating that were were drunk and aggressive, despite him not even being present the night before.

When trying to end the phone call, I asked him to talk to the manager and door staff from the previous night and to then email me with his/their response, his response was an indignant "I am NOT taking your email." After having expressed our concern over the multitude of bad reviews of the club (based almost solely on the rude staff) and with this unacceptably response, I informed the manager that he could expect four more negative reviews and four less customers and ended the phone call.

Avoid The Roxy and its staff unless you want to be abused and victimized.

Rude pushy ignorant untrained slow staff. There is a reason why places like this takes photos of you, your drivers licence and serve in plasticware. Its because it's attracting the wrong type of people and you can tell the staff hate the custom here. Sorry for sounding cliché but if you don't like your job.... LEAVE.

I wish I could give less. I've been to some terrible clubs in my life but this one is king. Bouncers doing what they want and the manager had no clue. Young, inexperienced and hopeless, don't ever go to this club!

Never go here. The place is small, music is terrible, people who go here are pretentious. And worst of all the door staff, never have I ever seen such miserable and rude control freaks. Theres an old guy in glasses that stands on the front who seems to randomly pick out people from a group that he doesn't want to go in then uses the excuse that they are "too drunk". It's happened on two occasions that I've been there with two different groups of people. Much better places to go to in Central London.

The late nineties decor and improvised fire doors do not contain the explosive sexual tension which is palpaple throughout this high end establishment. Spurred on by commerical R&B and flavoursome pitchers, you may find yourself not wanting to leave until a stink-bomb goes off in your face.

result.name: Pied a Terre
result.address: 34 Charlotte Street, London W1T 2NH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Delicious meal courteously served with tremendous attention to detail. A most enjoyable evening. Thank you.

This is one of my favorite restaurants anywhere, and one that deserves a special journey for a very special meal. Chef Marcus Eaves is a great Master at his craft, full of innovative ideas. You will come across dishes here that you will remember. The front of house Julien is super friendly and welcoming, and the staff are incredibly attentive in general. The wine list is extensive and beautiful too. I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

It always seems to be quite a bit about the presentation -from the way they neatly place their butter to how they serve the appetizers. The ambience was a little more crammed than most fine dining places, dimly lit with a low ceiling, but as usual the waiters were really welcoming and to go with the theme, food was served on plates the shades of black and grey. We opted for the two course a la carte meal and the meal was complete with tiny complimentary dessert treats served on a platter. The dishes may not have been particularly innovative but the quality of food was impeccable.

I am chagrined that it has taken me so long to get around to writing this review. Trust me when I say that hardly a day goes by when I don’t think about the wonderful dining experience we had at Pied a’ Terre last summer, and that every high-end restaurant we have patronized since has suffered in comparison. To explain: My husband, daughter and I from Los Angeles and my sister and her husband from Chevy Chase Maryland came together in England last June to attend Ladies’ Day at Royal Ascot. While the races were the primary reason for the trip (and did indeed totally live up to expectations), I was tasked with finding marvelous things to do during the week leading up to the main event. At this point I don’t recall how I came across Pied a’ Terre but WOW! We all agree that our lunch was one of the very best dining experiences we all have ever had – which as frequent world travelers and diners is actually saying something. The food was exquisite, but what really set the experience apart was the phenomenal service. I have written only two restaurant reviews in my life – and the one I wrote before this was for a highly touted “celebrity” spot in Los Angeles. While the food there was good, the service was beyond terrible and hence the experience was spoiled and certainly not worth the cost. Quite the opposite was true here. Although we were clearly “tourists” and hence unlikely to return any time soon, the restaurant staff treated us like royalty. The amount of pleasure this added to the meal and the experience is incalculable. As said, this was one of the very best dining experiences ever, and we will be forever grateful. Bravo!

Excellent food and service. We took my girlfriend's dad there and the restaurant did not disappoint! Great staff who really know the dishes and what to recommend. One of the best restaurants in London.

result.name: The Windmill International
result.address: 17-19 Great Windmill Street, London W1D 7JZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: very disappointed the women looked like they where little girls there was no curvy beautiful women i felt like i was watching a pole dance on a pole. service drinks was good but overall would not go back need more women that are not so skinny and un sexy.
Overall i thought the girls looked like gollum out of lord of the rings.

I came to The Windmill night club last Saturday 13.03.2010 with 8 of my friends. We had complimentary passes and never paid to come in, we sat with few girls, the music was just like you hear in a night club, we couldn't sit still and all started dancing and singing, including the girls. We had loads of dances in private booths, some of them even by 2 stunning girls at the same time, £20 well spent! Their stage shows are breath taking and we were stunned by some of the professional pole dancers.

Andrew
You cant walk through the door without girls grabbing you trying to rip your jacket off as you walk through... and no English girls

result.name: Mahiki
result.address: 1 Dover Street, London W1S 4LD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
AWFUL PLACE EVEN IF YOU'VE BOOKED WITH THEM!!

I had been liaising via email and telephone calls with two members of the Mahiki team since 16th October in regards to my birthday booking. I made a reservation for a table of 10 at 23.00 on Saturday 8th of November. 

My group arrived at 22.45. At the door we were told that my table booking was made for 21.00 and I was two hours late thus my table had been given away. I produced my string of emails and booking form that clearly stated 23.00 to the man at the door, but was told (rudely) that nothing could be done. I then asked if any larger, thus more expensive tables were available as it was really important to me that I got in and celebrated my birthday. I was told no, and I was also told my group was too big to be accommodated (there were only eight of us) - we were not allowed to enter the club. I asked to speak to those I had been liaising with but was told they only work during the day.

I would like to point out at this point that my group were all EXTREMELY well presented. The six females were in dresses and heels, and the two males wore shirts, trousers and shoes. We were a mixed group all with ID. We followed every recommendation you had made. I also had my large birthday cake with me as I had also previously discussed with you, a cake that had cost me £90.00 and had been made for the occasion with a Mahiki style theme. 

The man at the door was quite rude and did not sympathise with my situation. We were refused entry despite offering to pay double the original minimum spend for a table. Now here is where one of the biggest issues lies. We were asked to not stand outside the club and thus stood across the road as we discussed what to do and were approached by a local promoter. Behind us in the queue were a group of six females, one of whom I knew and had had a brief discussion with in the queue. I therefore know that her group did not have a table reserved and were already highly intoxicated. As I stood on the other side of the road I was absolutely furious to see that these girls were granted admission to the club. 

Let me tell you something about my group of eight. I myself am a white British female. There was a white male, a black male, a black female, an Asian female and three mixed race females. I believe my group were turned away on racial grounds. How can your organisation clearly have made a mistake and not offer any kind of agreement or compromise? Why were the group of six white, blonde females allowed in but we weren't? Why were we ushered to the other side of the road, as if to say we made the club look bad? 

I am absolutely outraged at the way I was treated and I honestly believe if my group had been all white, this would not have happened. It's disgusting that we were turned away after so many weeks of planning and liaising. Any mistakes made were on your (Mahiki's) part, and yet it not only cost me financially, but it ruined my birthday night, that I will never get back. 

It' also funny how since the night i have emailed them and had no reply. Disgusting

My friends took me to Mahiki when I was in town, as they were much talking about it and I was eager to visit it! My first impression was not that good though, as I expected a bit more from the interior than the Hawaiian décor. We ordered the Pina Colada cocktails and I started forgetting about the décor, as the music was something I loved a lot! The mix of pop and r&b and even alternative, is exactly what I need to get in the mood and to have a fun night out in the company of my friends.

Having booked Mahiki as a surprise for my nephews 21st Birthday, I can honestly say that I have never been so disgusted by the way that we were treated. Both the lady on the door and the so called manager were extremely rude and dismissive.
I had booked a table, had printed confirmation of the booking from Mahiki in my hand was told that they hadn't got my booking and they couldn't accommodate us, they never apologised or offered any alternative, they simply turned their back on us, left us out in the cold and walked away......VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!
AVIOD.

One of the first bars I went to when I moved to London. Loved it originally due to the novelty of it and that I was partying in London! A good place to bring people visiting because of the following:
1) played British classics, like Stop - Spice Girls, Rock DJ - Robbie Williams
2) just the right mix of 'poshness' and 'laid back ness' - almost (but not quite) like East meets West
3) famous stars have shown up here for those who are in love with the idea of partying in places where celebs have been (makes for a good story)
4) the drinks are amazing. the pina colado comes in a pineapple. 15 for 1 but very much so worth it!

This place has two floors - one that serves food (mediocre food but gets you into the club to enjoy it a bit before the mayhem starts and is a way to avoid the lines), and the other with a dance floor with tiki torches. For those out to really celebrate, get a group and purchase the Treasure Chest!

The female servers were dressed in Hawaiian outfits & the male servers as pirates. One the servers even spoke in a 'pirate' accent.

Overall - a bit cheesy & tacky & wouldn't make it a regular haunt, but a fun place overall to dance & bring friends from out of town!

Extremely slow experience, however this is made up for by the taste of the drinks. Very beachy vibe with fun, exotic music. Big venue, pricey on entry which isn't great. Very clean and welcoming. Bar staff are edgy and fun and very good at making drinks! Very different tasting drinks which are highly addictive! Load your wallet before arrival.

result.name: Brooklands Hotel
result.address: Brooklands Drive, Weybridge, Surrey KT13 0SL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
It's out of the way, bar the Mercedes World opposite. The bar is adequate at night. The breakfast and dinner is very good.

The salon is often empty whilst the Jacuzzi is often rammed. The treadmills in the gym are of high quality.

You can sometimes spot z list celebs there. I've seen Rob Green (former England goalkeeper and letter in of tame shots) and Steven Caulker (ex Spurs defender....now at QPR or Cardiff I thnk).
First rate cannot fault the service, room, staff or food. Would come back for the meal alone.
Awesome. Cannot beat it. Great experience
Perfect, I would come back here in a heartbeat.

The hotel is fabulous. The staff, especially Henry, looked after us. The couldn't have been any more pleasant. They were prompt with the various delicious meals we ordered, and were friendly and polite. What a venue! I've been back there at least twenty times since; the wine & ambience were more than enough of a reason to return.

result.name: Koko
result.address: 1a Camden High Street, London NW1 7JE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Brilliant! Koko should be on the London 'must do' list! Fantastic music venue in a great location. Camden is buzzing with pubs, clubs and basically whatever sort of evening you are after you can find it within a stones throw of Koko. The acoustics within the building itself are fab and drinks are not cheap but reasonable. Book yourself tickets to a gig here - you wont be disappointed.
I really love this place, the music is really cool. I went a day with a electro dj which I do not like, but the rest of the days, I loved the music played on this club.

This place is acceptable if you are already around Camden area.. It can be over crowded sometimes specially on Fridays & Saturdays but still you will have a good glimpse of the stage. Spacious and interesting decor. Good sounds and lights and the crowd can be friendly too.

Spacious, great decor and cheap. I've been here for a variety of nights. From Friday student nights to mid week gigs. What's good about Koko is that you can always get a decent view of the stage. It's styled like a theatre so there are many tiers to stand on and get a better view. The drinks deals are usually pretty good for London prices.

This a racist venue. I was there with my friend and when we showed our IDs they changed their faces, they went to speak with their chief and then they decided not to let us in giving all sort of different explanations that made no sense. It was so stupid and disappointing and for sure they did not have any other reason. Reading other comments in here I have no doubt this is a really a discriminatory venue so never going back.

result.name: Saint Georges Hotel
result.address: 14-15 Langham Place, Regent Street, London W1B 2QS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: if you like indian food please Try The Taj Restaurant in 10 Carlton Parade Orpington Kent BR6 0JB open 7 days a week Monday to Saturday 5.30pm to 11.30pm and Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm

Looking for a good spot for a business meeting with an unbelievable view? Look no further. With almost unobstructed views of london, their top floor restaurant makes for a great lunch spot. The prices are very high though so if anything, pop up for a coffee.
Fantastic location! Probably the most central hotel in London with some of the most stunning views too.
Great view, but spoilt by rude unhelpful staff, we didn't even stay to eat

Hace gracia alojarse en un hotel que comparte edificio con la BBC, nada menos que uno de los símbolos británicos, televisión y radio públicas utilizadas como ejemplo en el resto de Europa. Su ubicación es extraordinaria, a escasos metros de Oxford St., bien rodeada de locales para desayunar (alternativa recomendable al desayuno del propio hotel) y con buena cantidad de paradas de autobús para moverse por la ciudad con facilidad.

Lástima que con todas estas bazas para convertirse en una de las opciones más recomendables para alojarse en Londres, aparte de un precio bastante razonable, lo tiren por la ventana con un servicio poco atento y el escaso mantenimiento de sus instalaciones. 

El hotel ha ido experimentando una cierta degradación en los últimos años y en mi última visita no llegaba el WiFi a la habitación, a escasos metros de la puerta del hotel dormía un homeless (sin que nadie pareciera hacer nada por evitarlo), el agua en el lavabo de la habitación no tenía fuerza suficiente y nadie cambió una bombilla fundida desde el primer hasta el último día.

Lo peor es que no me guardaron una tarjeta SIM de giffgaff, a pesar de haberlo advertido en llamada telefónica y me aseguraran que me la guardarían sin problemas. El recepcionista buscó con desgana y escasa amabilidad.

En la parte positiva, estuve en Navidades y nos invitaron a un vino en su salón de la última planta, desde donde hay unas interesantes vistas de la ciudad. Además, los baños públicos de esa planta son un auténtico lujo.

result.name: OXO Restaurant, Bar and Brasserie
result.address: Oxo Tower Wharf Barge House Street, South Bank, London SE1 9PH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Last minute booking for a late lunch (4:30pm) and were informed before arriving that we would be expected to leave at 6:30pm which was fine. We booked for a Saturday so expected it to be busy, upon arriving we were shown to our table at the back, we asked if it was possible to get a spot near the front window as we wanted to see the view of the Thames, luckily they had a spare space for us. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, the food was reasonably priced but very very good - one of the best lunches I've had in London. Atmosphere was great and I would definitely make another trip there in the future #ReviewItForward

One of the best meals I've ever had. Incredible cocktails and wine. Great atmosphere, an amazing view of London and staff willing to bend over backwards to please you. Would thoroughly recommend for a special dinner and although it's expensive, it's definitely worth it.

Last week, we had business dinner at Oxo Tower. Everything was amazing. Qualified staff and flawless service. Pleasant ambience and stunning view of London. We were really impressed by the wine list which is exceptional. Perfect place for special occasions.

The WORST restaurant I have been to in years. To avoid at any means. the service is unpleasant, the food is barely acceptable and utterly overpriced.
never again.. There a thousand of better restaurant in London, this is crap. it smells of fish when you get in, the waiters have an attitude. etc etc.. everything you wish you never in one go.

I don't remember loving the food here (and I don't really remember what it was, period) so can't say much for that, but of course the views are amazing!! Just definitely request a window seat when you book because it's kind of not worth it if you don't have one!

result.name: Vortex
result.address: 11 Gillett Square, London N16 8AZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Had many a fantastic evening here catching some great jazz. A small and intimate venue, frequented mostly by serious jazz fans. Highly recommended, as is the cafe downstairs, which does a nice selection of food and drink at reasonable prices.

I'd give 5 starts for both the bar and the concert venue part of the Vortex club. The bar is quite small, has a lovely atmosphere and a very good selection of local craft beers. The concert venue is a bit small and the pillars right in the middle of the room are unfortunate, but the quality of the bands they choose make up for the small problems.
You want jazz, go here. Used to be in Church Street, but they were muscled out by Nando's. Pourquoi.
Loved it. Good old-fashioned burgers and solid drinks! ;)

Vortex is my favourite jazz club in London. There is a lovely ambient during concerts with people who really enjoy good music. Prices are reasonable and you can also become a member. Concerts are always on the first floor so you can enjoy the concert with out any distractions. Thumbs up!

result.name: The Athenaeum
result.address: 116 Piccadilly, London W1J 7BJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Nice hotel generally. I liked it more when they were dog friendly. We even went for a New Year's meal in their restaurant with our dog. We would also often go there after a stroll in Green park with the little doggie. Sadly they refuse entry to dogs in the restaurant/cafe area now, even though they sell themselves as a dog friendly hotel.

The hotel is fantastic and the spa is even better. I went for a day to use the pool and a certificate for a massage that my sister gave me for my B-day. I was welcomed with a smile, my bag was carried to the room and I was shown the spa and pool. I was amazed how nice everyone was even though I was here just for a day. The bigger surprise was that when I check out the front desk understood I had a B-day and later I found a mini cake and a card in my room. It was so sweet! Thank you

Very good hotel close to all facilites. Far away from the big hotel factory, you will get a special welcome from the staff (+1 for Katy). Rooms are very convenient and charming. I also recommend the whiskey bar with its fabulous range of single malt.

The afternoon tea is in the garden room, is quiet and befitting private event just what my niece & I intended. We celebrated her birthday with just the two of us. We had our own semi-booth area,we sat on comfy high back sofa chairs with tea served on the low table in front. But for larger groups they do have a normal table and chairs if required. Started out with a selection of finger sandwiches. The tea selection is displayed in a wooden book with your choice of Herbal Tea or Infusion.
 This was my third time here and so I anticipated their speciality dessert/cake trolley as the final course, all made in-house, and there is a wide selection of home made pastries to choose from but their Cheesecakes are the best in fact the wait staff gave me a take home on my previous visit here.The scones were delectable , served covered over to keep them warm with preserves and clotted cream. After the afternoon tea they even offered us a coffee to enjoy in the lounge/lobby area but we just declined. Afternoon tea in Athenaeum is the perfect way to spend the afternoon chatting,relaxing and a good excuse to celebrate anything!

What a fantastic experience. From the complementary fruit sent to the room to the signed welcome letter form the manager really make me feel at home. What other hotel in the country offers free bird food!! Little things like this really do make the difference The afternoon tea was phenomenal and rather reasonable and the spa extremely relaxing. The staff are remarkably friendly and really do make you feel welcome. Thanks again. Plus the room was spotless when I arrived. I will be coming here again.

result.name: The Princess Louise
result.address: 208 High Holborn, London WC1V 7EP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I love the cosy atmosphere, it's very welcoming and affable and I always enjoy an evening with friends here. I still can't figure out if they're really always booked or just don't take reservations since all of my efforts to book in advance have been unsuccessful. I like the food, the beer selection is extensive and staff are friendly. A summer night out on the terrace is splendid. And if it's not very summery in terms of temperatures, you get your own blankie. How lovely does this place get?

I had a good time with friends on the balcony a couple of weeks back. The atmosphere is very welcoming and the choice of drinks will cater to all tastes - there are fine spirits, a good selection of beer and ales, and wine, of course. Food is okay - exactly what you'd expect from a pub.

Good friends are for taking your phone away when you decide to drunk-text your ex, to give you comfort and support, and to take you to new places, places like this one. The Victorian atmosphere was really impressive while welcoming, and the selection and prices of the beer simply made my evening. Great place, a real quintessential traditional pub with a decent menu and friendly staff.

I've recently went to this pub for the first time, and one of the main reasons why I decided to visit a place like this, was all the positive comments of my colleagues. The pub itself is great - the atmosphere is lovely and I just can't wait to come back. The food was brilliant and more importantly, reasonably priced. Stunning place.
Beautiful old gin palace, restored to its former glory by Samuel Smiths. Fantastic range of organic drinks (try the cherry fruit beer!). A tourist attraction and a lovely place to eat and drink :)

result.name: Courthouse Hotel
result.address: 19 - 21 Great Marlborough Street, London W1F 7HL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: if I could give less I would do not stay here they photos are wrong it's worn down old battered stained marked broken impolite noisy crap over priced place to stay !!!! I've stay in a 3 star that's better for less
if you like indian food please Try The Taj Restaurant in 10 Carlton Parade Orpington Kent BR6 0JB open 7 days a week Monday to Saturday 5.30pm to 11.30pm and Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm
Very god hotell, great value for money, the best location, friendly staff and god breakfast.

I visited this hotel with my reward points on Hilton. The hotel is quite clean and conviently located to Oxford Circus & Canaby St, but far enough away that you don't feel over-run with congestion. Rooms are clean, properly insulated so you don't hear the neighbors and staff was helpful. My largest complaint was finding the location as it's hot indicated anywhere on the signage that it's a "Doubletree" property. So when I got into a cab and asked for the Doubletree near Canaby Street the driver looked at me like I had 3 heads. Pulling up to the hotel I realized why (virtually no identification of it being a Hilton or Doubletree property) That aside I had a pleasant stay.

Was lucky enough to get invited to a private movie screening at the beautiful Courthouse Hotel - what a beautiful gem! Don't be discouraged by some of the construction outdoors, it is absolutely immaculate inside. The staff are super professional and accommodating and the screening room is gorgeous with luxurious leather seats. A random highlight? I can't remember the last time I saw such a nice public toilet! I only wish I would have gotten to see one of the rooms - undoubtedly beautiful! My boyfriend and I felt like royalty for the night.

result.name: Royal Garden Hotel
result.address: 2-24 Kensington High Street, London W8 4PT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Great views of kensington garden and most of London .

Near royal Albert hall , a whole foods supermarket and the rest of kensington high street .

Rooms are clean and secure

Please Avoid the NCP car park at Royal Garden Hotel.

I ended up damaging my wheels there as the lanes are so narrow entering in to the car park. Once you have started driving in to the car park there is no turning back. You are lucky if you don't damage your tyres even driving at 2 miles and hour. It cost a l

No one is responsible for this as they say its at your own risk. Don't take the risk its not worth it. 

Please note I am commenting only on the car park and not the service of the hotel.

We had a fabulous tea at the Park Terrace Restaurant at The Royal Garden. Fluffy scones, gorgeous views, wonderful sandwiches and perfect cakes. Follow me on Google+ to read more Afternoon Tea reviews.

I have been lucky enough to stay in a number of 5 star hotels around the world all thanks to my job and I see Royal Garden as one of the best yet.

I was really impressed with the friendliness of the staff. They really couldn't have made us feel more welcome. I'm usually in hotels for business but this time I was in holiday mode with my wife so I was able to enjoy the surrounding area of Kensington. Which was fantastic. And Kensington Palace was just a stunning site.

I really enjoyed my time at Royal Garden and I hope to be back in the near future!

Very convenient location right in the heart of Kensington. Kensington Gardens and adjacent Hyde Park are great for walking, relaxing or bike riding. Hotel is surrounded by many different dining options as well as several close Tube stops for easy public transport anywhere. The staff was friendly and efficient and the room very comfortable.

result.name: Flask
result.address: 14 Flask Walk, London NW3 1HE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Nice little pub. I enjoy the outdoor seating for watching the crowds on a weekend. Very decent food and a nice bar staff.
Attractive pub, quick service with a smile, lagers spot-on, great location just off the Hampstead High Street. What's not to like?

Excellent Victorian pub at the top of Highgate and on the border with Hampstead. Excellent selection of draught beers and cracking fish and chips. Perfect to walk from or to walk to if around Hampstead Heath.
Another great pub in Hampstead. I've been coming here on and off for the past 15 years. Great stopping point if your coming from the Heath heading back to the high street.
Cosy little pub, fire place and beer brewed in North London, win win!!

result.name: National Trust - George Inn
result.address: 75-77 Borough High Street, London SE1 1NH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This place offers great selection of drinks and foods. Very ideal for spending some time chilling and relaxing. Had a lovely evening out with friends - a few ales and some chats. If it wasn't for my friend, I wouldn't have come here, don't really know why I'd overlooked it till now - it's great.

What an awesome evening, just happened to stumble upon a jamming session in progress... absolutely loved it! Fish and chips was excellent and the chef followed up with a personal call to the table to see if we were enjoying our food.

First off you can't beat this place for atmosphere and history. It dates back to 1677 and has the distinction of being London's only surviving galleried coaching inn. It also claims that both Shakespeare and Dickens drank here. 

Shakespeare died in 1616 so if he was here in 1677 the beer must have excellent restorative properties! Dickens actually gives it a brief mention in Little Dorrit and they have his life assurance policy on display in the Gallery Bar.

But it is the atmosphere that makes this a must visit place. Old corridors and stairways, low beamed ceilings all helping to create an ambience that is a genuine slice of London history.

The only downside is that all these features combine to make it extremely popular, so the place gets incredible busy and the wait to get served can be a long one.

I don't think you can get any more traditional than this. With the old beams and authentic atmosphere, George Inn is the epitome of a genuine pub. The seating, the chairs and tables, the brick walls, it all takes you back to older times and you almost want to pull out a sword and yell At dawn we ride. I can certainly imagine it. We live in less heroic times now so I'll stick to my reasonably-priced draught and good company and just think of what people looked like and talked about when they were sitting here a few centuries back.
Last week, me and my friends were there and we had an amazing time. Pleasant atmosphere and nice drinks. The service was really good. That's an ideal spot for chilling out after work.

result.name: Hakkasan Hanway Place
result.address: 8 Hanway Place, London W1T 1HD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Great place to celebrate something special. They got huge and amazing wine collection that you can check and they also offer mouth-watering meals and deserts! This place is really worth every penny for someone special! I am glad my husband brought me here!

My experience of Hakkasan leaves me feeling I've eaten well but in a noisy, impersonal restaurant with poor service.

We were greeted by a member of staff at the street level entrance who did no more than take my name and point (down the stairs). No welcome at all.

Once seated (by courteous staff) and given menus the wait for a drinks order to be taken was becoming uncomfortable.

Eventually when the food was at our table it was a very good Chinese meal. However, whether it is worth the money charged, is extremely debatable.

All in all, I feel this is a restaurant for a young, affluent crowd who are happy to spend an evening drinking with good food and talking at the tops of their voices to be heard.

I don't normally leave reviews but I thought I would leave one following our recent trip to Hakkasan Hanway Place because it is an expensive restaurant and lots of people visit as a special treat - therefore I want to let you know what to expect and not to get your hopes up too much. At the same time I don't want you to be put off.

I booked to go here with my girlfriend, after hearing about it from a well to do colleague and seeing that it has held a Michelin star for over a decade now.

We went and had their 'taste of hakassan menu', expecting it to blow us away, but unfortunately it just didn't.

The food is good, and undoubtedly better than any other Chinese restaurant I have been to previously, but in my opinion it isn't worth the money or Michelin star status and will leave quite a few customers disappointed if they're going for a special meal.

Our bill (for 2) came to £140, without wine, which is very expensive for the quality and quantity of food that you get. I have had much better food at this price point.

The atmosphere in the restaurant I felt was fantastic, very loud and almost nightclub like (quite a cool, sociable place to spend an evening) This might not suit everyone's tastes though but I personally thought it was great.

It's just the food didn't live up to what we hoped, it felt like a conveyor belt of the same dishes streaming out of the kitchen with no real passion or variance to what the chefs were doing.

We've only ever eaten at a 1 Michelin starred restaurant once before (in Austria), but there is absolutely no comparison. The one in Austria was easily 20x better without exaggeration. Perhaps we were just spoiled by our first Michelin star experience!

In summary, do give it a go, just don't put all your hopes on it for a big birthday / engagement / special occasion.

Amazing and unique restaurant! The atmosphere is exceptional, the staff is very professional and friendly, the food and cocktails are awesome! Such an amazing experience...definitely going back again! Love it!!

Great dining experience. The ambience is awesome, and the cocktails too, but I find most of the food is nice but not so good for the prices. I have not tried the most expensive of the dishes, too much for me.

result.name: The Fat Duck
result.address: High Street, Bray, Berkshire SL6 2AQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I chose the Fat Duck as the venue to celebrate with clients, because of its reputation and culinary wow factor. 
For my guests it lived up to all expectations. The food and service where all one could hope for. Sadly a party at another table were not particularly considerate, delivering peculiar noises throughout the evening. It might have been nice for a staff member to request a little decorum. Difficult, but better one annoyed guest than a room casting annoyed glances.
My only other comment is that, other than for entertaining, this is not a must to revisit. The menu was all but identical to my last visit two years ago.

We were coming to London from the US for something else, but have always wanted to try the Fat Duck, so we felt fortunate to score lunch reservations for this past Thursday. Not being the "foodie" in the family, I was a bit concerned that I wouldn't really enjoy some of the more out-there courses, but I need not have worried. The food was an ever-changing delight, playing with texture, presentation, scent and even sound. As more of a meat lover than a fish fetishist, they were kind enough to substitute one salmon course on the menu for a melt-in-your-mouth pork belly dish - amazing!

But better even than the food (really?!) was the staff. They seemed instantly capable of adapting their service style to the guests' attitudes, being more formal with some guests and more relaxed with others. I was concerned that I might be under-dressed, but I felt completely at home at all times. The staff worked together as a well-oiled machine, despite the cramped service quarters (they really need the refit), always at hand when you needed them, but never hovering or intrusive.

All in all, it was incredibly satisfying to have a long-anticipated experience live up to the expectations we had developed. This was, hands down, the most I have ever spent on a meal, so if it hadn't lived up to the dream, I would have been really disappointed. Tasty and terrific - what a relief!

They will open The Fat Duck in Melbourne in early February 2015, while the Bray location is renovated, so if you find yourself on that side of the planet, be sure to stop in. And when they get back to their refurbished nest, give the duck a big welcome home!

After the build up of years of fantastic reviews and TV coverage, we were thrilled that The Fat Duck lived up to the fanfare. Having been nervous that we might feel out of place, the wonderful staff (15 cooks & 15 waiters to 40 guests) ensured we were made to feel thoroughly welcome from the moment we arrived, with lovely little touches to make our anniversary lunch all the more magical. The food was incredible and the whole 4.5hr feast fantastically fun - what a relief that Heston never listened to anyone insisting you shouldn't play with your food! There's no denying that this isn't ever going to be described as a 'cheap' experience but, as a one-off treat and considering the incredible attention to detail (and months of preparatory work behind every dish), we felt it was definitely worth it for us.

Went here for lunch as an extra early celebration of a special occasion. We have watched Heston on TV, heard so much from friends and family and was super keen to go to The Fat Duck - dating back to more than three years! We finally made it after a friend posted on Facebook that The Fat Duck will be relocating to Melbourne (Aus) for six months. We didn't want to miss out in case they decide to take The Fat Duck all around the world and not come back anytime soon... So we somehow got a very last minute mid week reservation! The Universe always helps you when you know what you want eh? As a vegetarian going with a full omnivore, we got the vegetarian menu and the original menu. Word of caution to other vegetarians, they do warn you that gelatine is used in some of the dessert courses at the beginning. Personally I was relatively OK with that because well - I know I sound like a hypocrite, but I really didn't want to miss out on any course that I am already going to pay for (literally and figuratively)! So if you are strict, be very clear when making your reservation!

Anyway - as a vegetarian, I don't feel at all like I missed out (i felt really ripped off at Noma's residency at Claridges - but not on every dish). There were 14 courses and many came with a suggested wine. As I am doing DryApril and I don't drink wine, we started with a glass of rose champagne - but I really shouldn't have on an empty stomach, went straight to my head. Although the restaurant was at full capacity, you can't really hear the conversation next to you if you are not trying to hear them. I don't want to spoil the experience for ppl who haven't been, so I will just say, it's at times theatrical, but mainly, it's a gastronomic experience best reserved for a special occasion or for the hard core foodie - as it ain't cheap! Desserts are outstanding.

Note - they will be closed for 6 months (while in Melb) to completely refurb the kitchen (extension). The dining area will also be reduced. So if you want to try the original menu, what the bloody hell are you waiting for? Otherwise, wait - and the new kitchen should enable them to extend their repertoire.

A rollercoaster ride, with every course messing about with common sensorial experiences, and creating an expectation that is always surpassed and that prepares for the next one, consistently fulfilled with bewilderment. The accompanying wines were also otherworldly and the service was, not unexpectedly, simply perfect.
Price tag is hefty but, to my amazement, afterwards I couldn't help thinking that it was worth to the last penny.
What an afternoon that was!

result.name: Vinopolis
result.address: 1 Bank End, London SE1 9BU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Massive under bridge halls filled with wine cellars, self service wine tasting machines, wine knowledge exhibition and corporate functional room.

Came here on both business and personal occasions, very impressed by the selection of wine on offer.

The standard self service wine tour involves a 15 minutes minimal introduction on wine drinking etiquette, followed by museum style self guided tour to learn about wine production and tasting.

Wine is dispensed by self service credit machines, activated by a pre-paid wine token card. More expensive wine can cost more than 1 token per serving and can take up to 5 in some cases.

Wine tasting is an expensive hobby. To have a decent experience, beginner or advanced, you should be prepared to spend £25+ for the class/ tour/ self guided tasting session.

I am a wine lover and I always pay attention to the quality. On the occasion of special dinner with whole family, I wanted to buy a bottle of good wine. A friend of mine recommended to me Vinopolis. I hadn't seen such variety of wines before. It was above my expectations. The members of staff were very kind and helped me to make the best choice. It definitely was a good investment.
Fun place to spend an evening. Felt that you had to have some knowledge of wine before embarking on the tasting as it's all self serve. Would have been nice to have a guided option.

Excellent selection of wines, knowledgeable staff, tasters available - what a great way for any wine lover to wish away an hour. Prices range from £8-9 through to £800+ so there really is something for everyone. There is also the whiskey exchange next door if you fancy something a little stronger. Great place to stop off if you need advice on matching your wine to specific dish or pick up something special for a dinner party.

Stunning establishment where you can learn about wine tasting and sample some of the best wines from around the world.
I’ve been here a number of times with a group of friends or colleagues, and had a wonderful experience each time. 
After a 15 minutes introduction and wine tasting lesson in an auditorium, we got to wonder around the Vinopolis and sample 5 different wines of our choice per person (but if you are in a group of 4 or more, you can sample each other’s wines as well) :-D I never knew that white wine from Israel has such a delicate taste!
We could also choose 1 of 3 cocktails from the Cocktail Bar, which was included into our package.
It's a little expensive, but if you get a special offer, it's totally worth giving this place a go.
I loved every moment of it, and can’t wait to go back!

result.name: Belgo Centraal
result.address: 50 Earlham St, Covent Garden, London WC2H 9LJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Do you like Mussels, Fries and Belgian Beer? If the answer is yes to any of these three then Belgo is the place for you. 

There's a wide variety of delicious Beers - enough to satisfy a Belgian. The atmosphere is warm and friendly - though I thoroughly recommend booking if there's more than two of you. You may have to wait if you turn up without a booking, however there is a small bar you can sit in whilst you wait. 

Recommended: Mussels Provencale

Can also recommend for their Christmas menu.

Belgos is a hit an miss place most of the time. The only redeeming factor is that they serve Strawberry Fruli. In my younger days (before Yelp) I only knew of this place and Porterhouse in Covent Garden serving this beer. Now I know better! De Hems does it, I think the Slug and Lettuce had it on Lisle Street too! Plus, now there is Rekorderlig which is basically the same thing you can buy from supermarkets/get from most bars/pubs! No more need to feel bound to Belgos just to get a drink!

THE PROS
- Strawberry Fruli on tap, other Fruli flavours on bottles
- Mussels, mussels and more mussels. Seafood offers. Loyalty cards. Beat the clock offers (pay the time you order the food before 630 I think?)

THE CONS
- Sometimes food is waiting at the front of the kitchen so long it becomes cold when it arrives. I once ordered a steak which was COLD when I got it.
- Some mussels (like the garlic butter one - which is basically replacing French snails l'escagot with mussels) are super small for the price you are paying, it's almost not worth it.
- The place is always packed. Most of the time it is also packed with big groups of loud and rowdy people.
- Our order literally took over 1 hour to arrive. We were a group of 18 or so people. Really? Most of us ordered mussels! You just put different sauce in! - However, the manager agreed with our complaint and took off the price of starters (but only a few people ordered starters)

20 Years on and it's still a superb place to eat in covent garden. Amazing selection of craft European beers... Beat the clock for a cheap eat - We both had the Moules Provencal, not even a drop of the sauce left :) Love this place still

When for a nice meal , Been a few times to this place.
I decided to have the Thai muscles on the 16th July, ate about 9.30pm
got home about 11pm, at around 12pm my chest started to feel crushed and my heart started to hurt.

Short and Short, i ended up in hospital with the most excruciating pains in my chest. The hospital gave me blood test on blood test and thank god my heart was fine but they told me i had food poisoning of the worst kind!!!

So thank you for ruining my week. Shame because you were my fave restaurant

Better than I expected!
Went there with a friend for the first time, and I have to admit I was tad bit worried about waiting long for a table/for food/the noise, etc, basically what all the other reviewers had complained about on the web. But when we reached there, it was just about 15 minutes for the table (extremely reasonable considering it was saturday evening) and the food was served at a miraculous pace. The mussels and the chicken were simply grand. I loved it. Loved the cute beer bible too. It was a bit loud in general, but it was in a good way, jovial, bustleing, more like. I'd say it's worth visiting (especially for the lunch menus). Would definitely re-visit.

result.name: The Mitre
result.address: 291 Greenwich High Road, London SE10 8NA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Lovely pub. The drinks where crisp and clean. So we ordered 2 roast dinners at £12.95 and £13.95
For the beef. Unfortunately when they arrived to our table they was cool not cold. At the bar I asked if they could be heated up so they was hot. The oldest member of staff at the time deal with us and gathered the dinners to be warmed. Then shouted across the bar. These people are complaining their dinners are cold just dealing with this. Once the dinners came back they where hot and very nice. I'll not be going here again due to the staff attitude and the dinners in the Spanish galleon just down the road was £9.95. And look so much better and hotter. Plus the staff had a better attitude. It was also £2 a round cheap. Our round was 2 drinks.

I have not stayed here but the recent renovations have made it a really nice pub. There is an excellent selection of beers and it is one of only a few places in greenwich that shows football. The staff seemed friendly.
Enjoyed a lunch in mid-Septemer. Staff very pleasant and decor great.

Stayed there when we went to O2 to see Dolly Parton. We had two nights great there was music but we enjoyed it and it finished at 12. Staff could not do enough for us friendly and polite. There is plenty to see at Greenwich brilliant.
Typical British pub interior that could use an update, but outside garden is a lovely spot for a few pints in summer.

result.name: The Swan
result.address: 66 Bayswater Road, London W2 3PH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Nice atmosphere and quick service, but eerily tasteless fish and chips, and wildly overcooked peas. I always enjoy dessert, but tonight's sticky toffee pudding was stale, over-heated, with a horribly thick sauce that couldn't begin to sink in to the dry cake.
Disappointing, especially as they were out of the only vegetarian option on the mains menu, the lasagne.

Great London pub with a decent cask ale and draught selection. They make a very good fish and chips and your standard selection of pies. There is a nice outdoor patio in addition to an outdoor second floor terrace which overlooks the park.
Sunday evening with live music. A mix of diners and drinkers with a good buzz. Peroni priced at £5.05 a pint.
Very nice place. Good location, decor, incredible selection of beers and wonderful service. The 'fish and chips' is amazing!

We decided to use the Swan for an after-party for an event that was hosted yesterday. We didn't book or reserve but did call them in the morning to ask them if they could store cakes for us ready for the evening. They were very accommodating and more than happy to help out and donate fridge space. The place was busy in the evening but with 2 floors and 2 outside spaces there was plenty of room and the service was quick and efficient. A good evening was had by all and we just wanted to thank the staff for helping out at such short notice!

result.name: Annabel's
result.address: 44 Berkeley Square, London W1J 5QB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Richard Caring has ruined what was once the greatest club in London by letting in "the bridge and tunnel chavs". I'm sad to say I avoid it now.
good but stale
Regal dining in an almost Through the Looking Glass atmosphere. A great spot for a date -but not cheap by any measure.
it is expensive but is really quite mundane, except for the wine list, for which one pays dearly.
a much better experience than i would have expected given its "snob" reputation

result.name: The Borderline
result.address: Orange Yard, Manette Street, London W1D 4JB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Right side of cramped for a rock show. Great atmosphere, love the fact there are screens at the back to allow people with obstructed view to see. Saw The Dangerous Summer there, sound was great, atmosphere amazing, staff helpful. Although, to note, do not rest your cup on the stage. I learnt, the hard way, that the volume of the sound is great enough to move your cup.
Cheap drinks and fresh atmosphere on friday nights. Indie and britpop music for dancing till 4.00 am.

The Borderline is the referent to listen to new alternative/rock/heavy music in London. They have an amazing venue, the acustics are fine and the bands are awesome! If you like alternative music this is your place to go!

My favourite venue mostly because they feature my favourite bands. This basement can get pretty crowded meaning people have to watch from the stairs! But always a great atmosphere and good sound all round. As it's so small, getting to the bar can be a bit of a nightmare!
Packed small central London club, best for its indie bands and rough edges. Nothing sophisticated here but for beers and loud raw music, its pretty good

result.name: Londinium
result.address: London Bridge Hotel, 8-18 London Bridge Street, London SE1 9SG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I would rate this place as average. We had lovely 3 course meal on a Friday night. The meal was cooked well, we started with some starters and it was amazing. The main course, although it tasted good, I was a bit disappointed that it was a tad cold. Our desserts was also not too bad but the item that I wanted to try was not available.

Overall, it's a nice place to go if you like to be at a place where it is quiet and you would like to have a decent conversation where you can hear the other person. The meals are quite expensive and without the Taste London card, I won't actually visit the restaurant.

result.name: Le Gavroche
result.address: 43 Upper Brook Street, London W1K 7QR, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
had the most fantastic food at La Gavroche, great service and a tremendous experience of fine dining, Michel Roux even came over and spoke to us at the table.

Thank You
Fine dining at it's best. Amazing food, amazing staff, amazing atmosphere. Don't miss out on the business lunch, it's a bargain! 3 courses and half a bottle of wine for £54!
Outstanding service, very relaxed atmosphere, superb food

Visited Le Gavroche for a special occasion with my wife,son and daughter-in-law as I was 55 and had achieved 35 years service in the Fire Service and it was my sons 30th birthday so we had some serious celebrating to do!!!! My son chose the restaurant, although I have been a serious fan of Michel Roux for some time. The atmosphere was relaxed the front of house staff were incredible, they settled us down and we were well prepared for the sumptuous "Menu Exceptionnal" including the chosen wine list. This was dining heaven!! the dishes were incredible the wine was a real treat to the pallet and the chef, I believe it may have been Monica on the pass and the team that produced the dishes I would liked to have thanked personally at the end of the evening as they had designed a menu for my wife which had to be gluten free. No issues! just exquisite food. 5 star heaven!
Amazing atmosphere, excellent food and impeccable service. And also got to meet Michel Roux Jr himself too!

result.name: The Ledbury
result.address: 127 Ledbury Road, London W11 2AQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This restaurant is the height of sophistication. If the French cuisine is your passion, you will love this place. I had great first impressions. The service was flawless. What about the food? It was served in a very attractive way and was extraordinarily tasty. The wine was well balanced and with rich flavour. I had a very nice experience.

This is one of the best restaurant in London. They offer delicious and excellent food and their chef have designed each course to be brilliant and completely different. Their wine collection is also excellent. So far so good!

If you consider food and preparing it to be a form of art, like me, here you'll feel like at an exhibition. The ingredients are carefully selected and combined into some of the finest dishes I could have imagined. The presentation, though is what makes this place stand out from the others. Exquisitely arranged, the dishes look like works of art, making you feel guilty for destroying them with the mere purpose of satiating your appetite. But then the explosion of tastes bathes your palate and there's no longer guilt, just pleasure. Superb!
I brought my wife here last week and our experience was really great. The Ledbury has great and tasty selection of foods that is worth every penny spent. Great! Your deserve to have a 5-star or more!
The services here were great. The staffs are friendly and accomodating. The atmosphere was fine. The dishes themselves are fantastic. I would highly recommend this place.

result.name: The Flask
result.address: 77 Highgate West Hill, Camden, London N6 6BU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Incredibly cosy. Book ahead on a Sunday or prepare to wait. Saw Liam Gallagher.

I sat outside on a rainy Sunday afternoon, after walking from Highgate cemetery I was looking for somewhere to whet my whistle.

It's in a nice Highgate location on the corner of a little green. Picturesque from the outside. 

I'd go back to try the food if I was in the area.

Great food, great for drinks with friends in the sunshine - IF you get there early. If it is sunny and you aren't there by 11:30am then forget it. the food is good, but fairly over priced for what you get.

This pub has a nice setting but the food is boring, lacking taste, style and generally I wouldn't recommend to try.
The ingredients are poor too.

Maybe the cook will look at these comments and make improvements or maybe this is the first time they have been told about their food.
Won't come back to eat, there are other pubs in Highgate to try.
Harsh message but very true. Other people eating next to us were making the same comments but don't take the trouble to write a review.

This place feels like a hidden secret pub tucked away in the English countryside. Out of town enough to retain that quiet vibe the randomness of the interior will intrigue you as you discover more and more quiet drinking holes to tuck yourself into. A good size beer garden means this bar is perfect for relaxing with friends in all seasons.

There are two Flasks - one either side of Hampstead Heath, and I believe both take their name from the tradition of people going onto the heath to collect spring water - they'd stop at one or the other of these pubs to collect a suitable receptacle.

Of the two, this is, in my opinion, far nicer. It has a pleasingly higgledy piggledy interior, lots of small pokey rooms, and a courtyard outside which seems to be in use for a surprising amount of the year.

Both times I've been here to eat and I've enjoyed the food, most recently a Saturday lunchtime, when I was pleased to see two imaginative vegetarian options on the menu (I went for the stuffed Savoy cabbage, filled with mushrooms and pearl barley). It's a Fuller's pub, so expect the usual Fuller's selection of ales, plus one or two guest ales.

Staff were very welcoming, and it seemed to be mostly table service - not normally my preference when it comes to pub food - but here it seemed to make sense. Kid friendly too - perhaps because of the time of day we were there, but most of the tables seemed to be occupied by families.

result.name: Radisson Blu Edwardian, Heathrow
result.address: 140 Bath Rd, Hayes, Middlesex UB3 5AW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Excellent service, quiet and comfortable room and stylish decor.
Excellent price for one night and a weeks parking with hotel hoppa bus transport from outside reception. This hotel is definitely worthy of its 4* rating.

Only small gripe was a little confusion over parking ticket validation at front desk which is why this review isn't 5*

Got a room with a broken AC. Freezing. I can't turn it off or turn on the heat. But that wasn't the problem. The problem is their service. Or maybe tonight's crew needs a lesson in customer service. From time to time, I can get a room with missing something or broken something. It's how the hotel fixes the problem is what's important. I called the receptionist, hotel duty manager, house keeping all multiple times. Their phones rang endlessly. No answer from any of them. It's past 12 midnight and had to go down the reception. I asked the person on duty what is the best number to dial to get a hold of someone in this hotel. He said the receptionist. Well, I mentioned to him that I dialed it multiple times and all it did was ring. What he said to me was that they were too busy to answer the call. What? I'm in the service industry. You answer that damn phone within 2 to 3 rings. If you are busy, you can tell them that you need to call them back. You don't ignore that phone rings. REALLY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. THE WORSE I'VE HAD IN ALL MY TRAVELS. 

The only reason i am not giving this a one star is because of their concierge, Smitty. He's very helpful. Otherwise. ONE stars.

For a hotel that would normally score quite highly for actually accomplishing my usual trifecta of requirements (Plugs next to bed, a shower I can stand up in, and free wifi), I was extremely disappointed with my recent stay here. 

There are some ridiculous policies regarding where guests can congregate and drink, the staff all seemed bored and uninterested, and even downright abuse at one point. I got the feeling of being a second class citizen as I was attending a sci-fi convention. Not what I would expect from a 4 star hotel and has made me reluctant to go back. I know I am not the only one from the convention that felt this way.

Oh, and one last thing, if there is a do not disturb sign on the door, ringing the room is actually disturbing.

Do not be deceived by it's look. The worst ever service for any hotel providing special events. Not only the food was crap, it's was my nephew's birthday and every one invited was told the car park was free, that is On exit your parking ticket will be swapped for a free exit ticket like most hotel events I attended in UK. At the front desk £7 was demanded from every one wanting to leave. It was such a joy killer and total embarrassment for my nephew. Some of the quests were disgusted and it spoiled the special moment for my nephew who came down to tell the front desk man that his deal included free parking. Ugly scenes erupted as the front desk was having none of it. This hotel is a complete disgrace and I really cannot imagine why people wanting to celebrate such a special occasion would want it to be held in such an unruly place. The owners / operator should hang their head in shame. They spoilt Andrew's big moment.
