The selection of drinks is great and the normal average price, and the food is nice with some items on the menu changing from time to time. It's a great all round place really!

Overpriced school dinners badly prepared besides an arrogant and rude waiter who couldn't care less. The fact that the portions are ridiculously small doesn't matter, as the stodge is hardly eatable. This grand old building should deserve better than the those in charge, what a shame.
Great pub, great vibe &deco. Very friendly staff.
Nice place with a friendly and mixed crowd. Decent beer/lager/cider selection. a great example of Victorian architecture.
Trendy... too trendy

result.name: Dirty Dicks
result.address: 202 Bishopsgate, London EC2M 4NR, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Dirty dicks is worth a visit, just to see the interior! The pub is charming, with its old, wooden beams and Elizabethan feel. We did not order food when we visited this pub, however, the drinks were decent and typical london prices! Worth a visit and very conveniently located to liverpool street station.
Oldy worldly feel. As per other reviews the all wood interior won't be to everyone's tastes. Staff were friendly, decent pint and the burger and soup were excellent

Having giggled over the name for years, I finally popped inside this place recently. The decor is suprisingly charming - it's got a very old, 'Elizabethan public house' feel, with low ceilings and little wooden booths for gossiping. Sadly nowadays it's full of suits, and has a weird open smoking area in the front which makes the whole place smell of old man!

The name has put me off going in here for years. You can't miss the neon lights which adds to the affect flashing at you from opposite liverpool street station. It's very wooden inside, kind of reminds me of what country western film with wooden barrels for tables. Quite cheap for the area.
Good beers on the top floor

result.name: The White Horse
result.address: 1-3 Parsons Green, London SW6 4UL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This is one of the best pubs you can go to in Parson's Green in the Summer. It can get very busy but that doesn't make your visit much less enjoyable. Really close to the station and situated right by a lovely little green space. A vibrant little pub with a wide selection of drinks.

It's a nice airy pub and a good outdoor area, but I came to have some Belgian beers their menu listed. Both times they were out of Kwak, Karameliet and Duchesse du Borgogne which aren't easy to find - so I was disappointed.
I'd go back, but only if they actually do stock the beers. 

I settled for a Hoegaarden Grand Cru in the end :)

The staff is very nice though and its a busy pub in general. The food is good, their scotch eggs are done perfectly!

I like this pub and they have some great beer. The food was really disappointing though. Tasty enough but £14 for a few bits of butternut squash and frisee wasn't what I'd call good value for money. Worst thing was that the (friendly) waitress agreed with me but did nothing about it! Shame.

Situated in a great location on Parsons Green and only a hundred metres from the tube, The White Horse is one of the best known pubs in south west London. The beers are great (with my personal favourite Hoegaarden on tap), but unfortunately the clientele are a little pretentious. 

Regardless, The White Horse is definitely worth a visit, especially if its sunny and warm outside as they have a great outdoor space.

Nice big old pub. Large selection of beers, look especially at the US ones available by bottle. Enough, efficient staff so there's not much of a wait even if it's busy. The home made pork scratchings are awesome.

result.name: Pennyhill Park Hotel
result.address: London Rd, Bagshot, Surrey GU19 5EU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Pennyhill Park has the feeling of luxury from the moment that you arrive. My steel drum band has covered weddings and corporate events at this venue and enjoyed it.

WOW what a Day. I had a spa day given to me from my family. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the facilities were excellent. There is something for everyone. If you are looking to be pampered you should go. You wont be disappointed.
Sunday lunch in the brasserie, excellent!!!
A brilliant experience.
The very best hotel you could possibly find, with simply outstanding Service and Facilities in Surrey and Hampshire.

result.name: O2 Academy Brixton
result.address: 211 Stockwell Road, London SW9 9SL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A bit run-down, but a great venue nonetheless. The most obvious observation was the raked floor -- clever considering everyone gets a great view of the stage...but prepare for an achey back at the end of the show from resisting the urge to tip over for 2 hours! As per most venues, the washrooms were too small, but the Academy is about MUSIC, not the loo! The sound was fantastic -- my friends and I enjoyed a great show there.
Favourite place for gigs in London. Have seen so many great bands here. Why don't more places have a sloping floor towards the stage? Makes it so much easier to see from the back..

A really great music venue. The sloping floor is great as everyone is able to see the stage. It's a really good size also and I love the art deco interior! Drink prices are a little steep but overall an awesome place to go to listen to live music.
The best venue in London to watch a band, the worse venue in London for drinks. £5 a can of Tuborg is an insult!

Really good night at the Brixton O2. Been here a few times years ago. Lovely old building though in all honesty could probably do with a lick of paint. Had my bottle of water confiscated at the door which I found a little odd as people where able to buy booze inside the venue in plastic cups and take to their seats. Just about made it to the front row of the balcony in virtual darkness which I'm sure must be some sort of health and safety breach but nonetheless we had a great view but was told not to stand during the gig...at least the first three rows where! Overall though a good music venue and would go again.

result.name: St John's Smith Square
result.address: St John's Smith Square,Smith Square, London SW1P 3HA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I had coffee here on a sunny Saturday morning and it was amazing. There was a bit of a crowd but the staff somehow managed to serve well and up to the place's standards. Great coffee and food make the Square Cafe an adequate option for breakfast or brunch.

Great unique cafe restaurant in the Crypt of the Church. There is no table service as such but service from staff on hand is great and the value is second to none. This place specialises in soups, I've not had a bad one there yet. Also there is usually a choice of 3-4 hot dishes which change on a regular basis. There's also a decent choice of Salad and some killer deserts and cakes. If you are in the area and fancy an different lunch setting you can't go wrong.

Nice restaurant. I recently went here for a meeting with a friend who I haven't seen for a long time - she's just returned to London so i wanted to take her someplace classy where we could have a nice conversation. Well, now after last night, I think I could have chosen a better spot. Everything was good but it just wasn't enough - it could have been better.

I work nearby so have been here quite a few times. The food is ok, if quite expensive for what you get. I was very disappointed at lunch today to be asked to move tables halfway through eating, so a table of 8 could sit down. How amateur. I won't be back.
Nice to be in a great day

result.name: Lamb
result.address: 94 Lamb's Conduit Street, London WC1N 3LZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Love it here. Very friendly staff, great drinks, lovely atmosphere. Also having no music makes for a much more pleasant experience. Recommended!

This place does have character. Lovely decor, although it may look a bit tired, but all the cheery people chatting over a beer are not. So, you get a perfect ambience of traditional surroundings, wide selection of drinks, and a vibrant atmosphere on one of the nicest street in the city. I love this place, not a big fan of the food, but I never enjoyed pub food anyway, so scratch that. Great fun with friends every time we come here.

a great local feel pub in the heart of London , with a fine selection of pub grub and ales. 
from the outside you can see the pub is a historical landmark with beautiful tiling on the walls, which matches the warming but shabby interior. the staff are all very friendly and happy to introduce you to the range of drinks they offer. it's a great place to have a drink and think about all the generations of drinkers that have been there before you.

To drink cold beers after work is like a sweet escape from the routine. I have many problems with my colleagues these days and it is hard to cope with every situation. It is almost impossible to get on well with everyone, of course. But sometimes I'm annoyed of the existing problems and worries. 
Anyway, the Lamb is a welcoming pub, where you can have a drink or two (or three). I've checked the website, but unfortunately it is not working properly.
The price list is normal, but be prepared to spend more money on refreshing drinks. It is just normal when you go there to stay several hours with your friends.
Great traditional pub in Holborn. It's strong point is it's excellent selection of foreign and guest beers. Different crowds drink here at night from lunchtime, but always friendly and welcoming.

result.name: The Vintry
result.address: Abchurch Yard, The City EC4N 7BA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: The food here is really impressive for a pub...it's basically the equivalent of a Michelin chef but and normal prices. It's had a complete renovation and changed its menu in the past 8 months so well worth a look for dinner on a week night. They also do weddings on weekends, and me and my wife and our guests were very very happy with the wedding reception we had there in May. Great staff, great food and great decor and vibe.
A crap all bar one.
Just a pub, would not go there for food. Atmosphere is always good but just too expensive and it can take up to 20 minutes to get a pint at the bar...

Good Restaurant
Nice Place

result.name: The Half Moon
result.address: 93 Lower Richmond Road, London SW15 1EU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I went to see a gig by a musician friend, Nibs van der Spuy, at the Half Moon earlier this week. The place has a pleasant atmosphere when you walk in, the lady behind the bar who took the orders was pleasant, although the food delivery was very slow, and nothing was particularly good, nor bad.

I wasn't going to write a review until I found that the price of a Diet Coke, out of the machine, is £6. That is iniquitous.

Food is ok but I had to wait 50 minutes for my burger! And 3 months after it is not better, just waited 40 mins for some chips!

Here I am again a year after and It's got worse: we ordered an hour ago and still waiting!
I have to the half moon three times in the last month,on every occasion they have run out YOUNGS ORDINARY.How is this possible.

Great music, great atmosphere, some great life music bands.
Never tried their food, only a couple of drinks, I simply enjoy the atmosphere, deco and music. 
Visited for a friend's birthday celebration every year.
Amazing music nights and fantastic packed atmosphere. I love the staff and completely adore performing on stage when I get the chance. The opportunity to get involved is always favoured. I love it!

result.name: The Blind Beggar
result.address: 337 Whitechapel Road, London E1 1BU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Food was brilliant, the beer garden was tranquil and secluded. It was like i was transported outside of london. 
I've worked in whitechapel a while and always walked passed this pub, dismissing it. I happened to have a bad day at work and need a pub lunch. Im so glad i gave it a go.
I will be going back! 
So pleased i gave it a chance. You should too. Very happy customer.

Nice little pub with a rich history. Drinks are very expensive in my opinion and the selection isn't very big. Nice beer garden though and pleasant staff. Wouldn't spend all night there, but good for one or two.

I love having a pint here not only because it is the place where Ronnie Kray shot George Cornell which makes it a piece of London's gangland history but because regardless of modern clean interior it has that good old fashioned taste that I find very appealing in a pub. I have to warn you that The Blind Beggar is not the cheapest place around and don't be too surprised when you end up paying 4 pounds for a Peroni. If you get lucky you might even see the resident cat. Overall it is a really nice pub filled with interesting, friendly people who are always open for chatting.
Really nice staff. they show matches, very good communications. they have propper cheese and meatboards and they have a really nice garden with wooden tables and billiard! u have to try it!
Very nice pub in Whitechapel road x

result.name: Frontline
result.address: 13 Norfolk Place, London W2 1QJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: no value at all, small portions. £68 per person for a micro starter (£12), micro main (£19) and dessert with 2 bottle of wine for 6 people. The "main" was composed by 2 tiny pieces of lamb, nothing special. If you like to go to a restaurant to eat, this is not the place for you. The food quality does not not justify such a high price. And I keep ask myself why pretentious restaurants like this should serve such a small portions. Is there any intrinsic reason?

The staff is very welcoming! The food was pretty good and delicious. We had plenty of dishes to choose from, all at very reasonable cost. The sticky toffee pudding was incredibly yummy!!! Recommended this British Restaurant. It is clean and comfortable, all adding to a romantic & relaxing atmosphere. Superb place to spend a lovely evening! Will visit again :)))
I really liked the ambiance. This is one of the very few London restaurants which bring that authentic old fashioned atmosphere.

Had a lovely meal today. It felt like it was one of the best in London. Ingredients from the farm were fresh and well cooked. The lunch dishes came with a very good taste and pleasant surprises. Lovely wine. My husband and I were searching for a venue for a party. We felt it is too good for a party. This restaurant should be enjoyed with your partners or adult family members. Will come again.
Perfect food and service.

result.name: The Haggerston
result.address: 438 Kingsland Road, London E8 4AA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This is one of the cool places, you need to to go to be seen at, regardless of the fact it is grimmy, a bit far from other bars, the bar staff probably couldn't care less about your number of Twitter followers, the floor is sticky, the bar is too crowded to get served most of the time.

Regardless of all that, it is an okay, bar/pub but don't believe the hype really, you could start here or end here, but you might have a bit more fun in Dalston.

An aside, my friend got pickpocketed for his phone and no one on the staff cared because it was late and assumed he was drunk, regardless of the fact he doesn't drink alcohol, just a warning to keep your stuff safe.

What’s the most important thing when making a trip to your local independent pub? Great atmosphere right? Well The Haggerston in Dalston definitely has it – every night seven days a week with the ‘it’s a given’ increased human activity on weekends. If you don’t feel like going out on the town but want to stay up being merry with friends till the early hours of the morn TSL suggest coming here. It’s open later than most pubs and there are yummy pizzas (under £10) to fill rumbling bellies...

To read more on this and other unique independents, why not visit the Twenty Something London website - and discover a London you never new about!
Perfect weekend pub. Complete with a decent beer list, and casual folk who are up for a few pints and some laughs. Nothing pretentious about it. A good Saturday night local.

I guess you could do worse than The Haggerston but it wouldn't be my first choice. The inside is a bit glum, and the outside has those annoyingly wobbly benches that are a nightmare to navigate. The staff were a bit on the smarmy side but I guess that's to be expected in these parts. In future I'll be heading to The Fox just down the road.

I had the final drink of a particularly boozy Saturday in here and concluded the evening on a rather agreeable note. The outdoor/beer garden area is great if you can get a seat (we did) and the selection draft beer was of the quality that you would probably expect. Good atmosphere and a temporarily confusing yet amusing WC.

result.name: Lima
result.address: 31 Rathbone Place, London W1T 1JH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Amazing food with a terrific presentation. All the dishes included Peruvian vegetables and spices that you'll have to Google just to learn what they are. A great food adventure.
The food is sensational. Order the sea bass cerviche. In fact, order anything the cuisine is wonderful.

Casual, small, wonderful restaurant with terrific foods and some that are like the tastes of Nobu in New York. 

Stick to basics
Great food, staff very friendly and know their food. Loved it. thank you.

Highly overrated! I had braised Octopus for starter and lamb shoulder for my main. Both of them overcooked, to the extent that you couldn't taste the Octopus and lamb anymore. I wonder how they got a michelin star, they don't deserve it!

result.name: Freemasons Arms - Shepherd Neame
result.address: 81/82 Long Acre, London WC2E 9NG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Never felt so unwelcome in any pub in my life. Cider off! You sit where you like - but not in most places because they are reserved for Sunday lunch. You can watch the F1 racing at Silverstone until we decide to turn it over without asking.
Complete disregard for paying customers - first and last time EVER. Plenty more hospitable places very close.

Big pub near Covent Garden, Bow street area. Shepherd Neame ales, nice choice of good beers. Large, handsome bar with lots of polished wood. Lots of history round here, some Masonic and other memorabilia. Close to Freemasons Hall.
Good place for a few at lunchtime or afternoons.

Any Shepherd Neame pub must be good.

Loved the pub and the beer, very convenient when visiting theatres around Drury lane, Leicester Square etc.

Very pleased to see the Freemasons had a good selection of ales including some winter warmers. My favourite Bishops Finger draught was how I remembered it from several years ago when I lived in Canterbury and used to frequent the Cricketers.

Only downside is that Shepherd Neame is brewed in Faversham and not Yorkshire (just joking).
One of the better pubs in the area with a good selection of beers. It does get very crowded at times but all pubs in Covent Garden do.

Great pub with friendly staff always plenty of screens to catch up with the latest sports action.
Simple but delicious menu with a good choice of different beers available on tapor from the the bottle,
Birthplace of the FA!

result.name: Royal Vauxhall Tavern
result.address: 372 Kennington Lane, London SE11 5HY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Brilliant place for a night out! Highly recommend the Bingo Night on a Monday! Great, entertaining evening to help you get over the start of the week.

They also do brilliant themed 'Push The Button' nights on a monthly (end of) basis that are a great laugh with awesome music that everyone loves and quirky gags throughout the tavern (fans, kinder egg toys, giant glasses, hand clapper slappers, etc) With a performance after midnight and a DJ bringing great tunes!
Been there several times on sunday and saw the wonferfull show with our dame and the great after party. Would love to go every sunday but live in antwerp :-(
a bit pricey but it was my first time and i loved it - I went for Miss Sherry Vine :)

This used to be a fantastic venue on a sunday when it was the dame edna experience. 
Now its charlie hides tv it has gone downhill. 
It was a 5 star venue before. Now its barely a 3.
 I hope edna comes back
being around the corner from this venue i have spent many sunday afternoons with mates . i stil go there on special ocasions and hope the RVT wqill be there for a very long time

result.name: The Islington
result.address: 1 Tolpuddle Street, London N1 0XT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Went to the Islington for the first time on Wednesday 20th of August 2014 for a (free!) gig by the Canadian band The Arkells; this was their only UK tour date to my knowledge. 

My friends and I travelled an hour or so on trains to get to the venue having never been there before. 
The building's floor-to-ceiling windows were fully opened giving it the air of a European cafe; upon arriving the shift-manager immediately began moving chairs & tables around to make sure the 4 of us could be accommodated comfortably. 

A wide selection of American craft beers, and even some Icelandic beer, is available in addition to higher-end more regular choices of lager/ale/cider & wine, and an attractive back shelf of liquors. 

The decoration was hip without being too try-hard/hipster, clean & fresh and (in my opinion) a cracking background alternative music selection (including The Cure & The Cars to the best of my recollection)

As for the gig itself, it was busy but not crowded; it was easy enough to move through the crowd and get to & from the bathroom/bar. 
The stage was brightly decorated and looked very professional (like the backdrop to a small TV performance) but the real standout quality was the acoustics - watching a quickly recorded iPhone video, it sounds more or less perfect. Very little distortion, ideal volume - I was so impressed I tipped the guys working the sound desk £10 to get themselves a couple of pints!

Fantastic energy at the gig, felt like being back at small intimate gigs at The Wedgewood rooms back in the 90s :)

The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.
Overall, I would definitely recommend this place for a quiet drink or a big night out, and hope to return sooner rather than later.

I started to go in here for gigs about 8 months ago. Have enjoyed it every time and continue to go back. Love the pizza and they have a fav of mine, Brooklyn Lager. Read other reviews on here that are negative and really surprised me. Great venue.

This is a great place to have a few beers and watch some good local bands. It has lots of nooks for sitting in and a nice and friendly atmosphere. Good selection of drinks available and very close to the high road.

This place is amazing. Attractive interior and live music almost every night is very catching. Customer service is great and friendly.
I am happy to come back.

Most rude and contemptuous treatment I have ever received as a paying customer. I came here with my kids from the playground opposite to get them some drinks on a hot summer's day. What a mistake! They were quite happy to take my money to sell me juices for them, but when one of them started to cry the grumpy manager was over in seconds to tell me "we can't have that in here, you'll have to take him outside". So we didn't get a chance to drink our over-priced juices and we weren't offered any money back. DON'T come here with children, and by the looks of some of the other reviews on the web about the manager's rudeness and the over-pricing, don't come here without them either!

result.name: The Dog & Duck
result.address: 18 Bateman Street, London W1D 3AJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I went to this place in September 2010 and the experience was nothing less than memorable. To this day, what happened at The Dog & Duck remains a crowd favourite whenever I am in a social gathering and the people around me start to share bizarre stories. I walk in with my wife and the place seemed nice and quaint. We asked for a couple of pints and ordered our fish and chips, and bubble and squeak. While we are waiting for our food we spot a mouse running around, under tables and people's chairs while they are enjoying themselves and are completely oblivious to the fact that the creature is there. While we are enjoying our pints, the bar tender "passes gas", or if you may, "farts" and it was a loud one. He smirked and probably thought to himself "nobody heard that". Well guess what, this Portuguese-Canadian did. After laughing about it and asking myself, where the f--- am I?, I tell the bar tender that there is a mouse running around in the pub. He says "are you sure?" I said, I only had a couple of pints, my sight is still pretty good and it surely wasn't a Dog nor a Duck. He said "well maybe it's from the construction next door. I assure you it has nothing to do with the cleanliness of the establishment." REALLY?! Coming from the guy that just farted?!
If it weren't for the exhaustion of a long flight from Toronto, I would have probably been upset, since it was the first day of our honeymoon and tour across Europe, we just laughed it off.
I highly suggest renaming it to The Dog, Duck and Mouse. Or just get a Cat.
Rude staff, crap food and watered down beer.

Great atmosphere ...
Always busy but the service is spot on . 
Good selection of beers and ales.
The food is ok. I specialty like their onion rings,

Decent pub grub with a fine draft selection.
There is an upstairs George Orwell dining room, in addition to the bustling pub atmosphere downstairs. The food was of high quality, the beers even better. They will do a pre-theater menu if you wish. A good find while wandering around.

We went there for lunch and ordered onion rings, fish and chips and some kind of beef pie.
Except for the onion rings the rest of the food wasn't any good, the pie had a dried piece of beef, and the fish was tastless, we left the pub still hungry. The survice was ok, but I wouldn't recommend going there for lunch

result.name: The Swan
result.address: 46 Hammersmith Broadway, London W6 0DZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Tried to charge almost £15 for a couple of drinks then acted weird when I asked for the receipt. Took about 5 minutes to produce the receipt, never apologised when they gave my money back. Untrustworthy.

Big London pub fitted out in Victorian splendor. Large range of beers including a draft ginger beer - I was offered a taste - but did noy buy. Clearly doing well in an area with so many pubs - so they must have it right here.

A spacious pub, nice interior, located right next to the hammersmith station. Perfect spot for a few pints before a gig at hammersmith Apollo or if you're just in the area. Might also be worth it dropping by to avoid the overcrowded pubs in more central areas. They have a large variety of guest ales on tap and prices are reasonable. Theres also a dining area reserved upstairs , though we haven't tried food here...yet..

A large Victorian pub opposite Hammersmith underground / bus station. It is very impressive on the outside and equally impressive on the inside with high ceilings, copious amounts of polished wood, etc. Remanants of (original?) partitions divide the space into various seating areas and there is a fine upstairs bar / dining area reached by a superb winding staircase. Most impressive, from my perspective, are the ten handpumps dispensing a range of standard Nicholson's regulars - Pride, Timothy Taylor's Landlord, Adnam's Broadside, Sharp's Doom Bar, etc. as well as guests. With this pub on the corner, why on earth would you go to the dingy William Morris 'spoons just along the road?
Enjoyed the evening and food. Just don't take any crap from the ginger waiter

result.name: inSpiral Lounge
result.address: 250 Camden High Street, London NW1 8QS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I really, really wanted to like this place but sadly I can't say I'll be rushing to go back! 
Service was absolutely awful. Not only did it take more than 20 minutes for our juices to arrive, then another 30 minutes for half of our order to arrive, then to be told that our initial food order was lost so we were asked the rest of our food order TWO more times before they finally got it right... ages after the initial order was made. They would also greatly benefit from a table numbering system as the waitresses were all over the place not knowing which plates were going where! 
The food was ok... nothing exciting and definitely not good value for money. The juices were nice albeit pricey but the view of the canal was nice. 
Great potential but sadly very disappointing.

I can't believe how poor the food is now. They have changed the menu and service about two months ago. You could get an array of vegan dishes plus raw food before but now it's the same thing day in day out. Cooked food comes to you tepid at best. What was wrong before? Nothing. I don't think I will be renewing my membership, what good is 15% off when you walk away regretting you spent a penny. If it ain't broke, don't fix it. The front line staff are great. This rant is for management.

Ideal place where you can enjoy the best veggie food ever. I've ordered my favourite raw products several times and I was very content. Wide selection of super foods and seeds, healthy drinks and chocolate, of course. I liked all of them. Friendly and knowledgable staff.

A friend and I ate at inSpiral lounge and was pleasantly surprised. As a former meat eater, I didn't think food without meat was worth considering as I thought it would taste dull but inSpiral changed everything. The food was soooo tasty! Whenever I visit Camden, inSpiral lounge is a must! I've tried the delicious lentil curry, the mushroom tart, the incredible hazelnut tart and will soon be going there to taste their vegan ice cream. The service was brilliant and the view from the restaurant is beautiful, especially at night. I would definitely recommend inSpiral Lounge.
Visiting London and got the best veggie burger while I caught up using the free internet on my laptop! Two thumbs up!

result.name: The Minories
result.address: 64-73 Minories, London EC3N 1JL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Delicious place with delicious food. Even a basic meal like a burger is presented beautifully, on a wooden board along with some chips. Staff is great and quite helpful I might say.

This manager is this pubs worst enemy for customer relations, and needs replacing NOW. I've never heard anything like this, how the fck can you treat customers like that who have been coming here for 6 years and cancel their night with no notice, he ruined over 100 peoples evening. In a very competitive market where profit margins are narrow and squeezed you cant act like an arrogant twat without consequences, and this manager is so unskilled, so unprofessional, and so completely useless, it beggars belief. He should not even be employed to clean the toilets as he'd find a way of fcking that up to, he literally can not organise a piss up in a pub, but does seem to have the ability of ending a piss up in a pub. He needs his position seriously reviewing... And should really never work in the industry again, what a waste of skin.
Bostin breakfast with a good cuppa, friendly service all at a reasonable price

This is a good solid pub and open on the weekends, this pub is massive and has at least 2 bars, they serve good food. 

A main positive for me is they show football matches, but this might be the opposite for people. They sometimes only show it in the back bar so worth checking with the staff if you are looking for a match.

This is chain pub, but Stonegate Pubs seems to have a good idea on what makes a good pub.

So if you are in the area and don't fancy the expensive St. Katharine Docks, I'd recommend here.

I work around the corner and this is typically the perfect good old pub for afterwork drinks with the colleagues or to catch a game.

The pub is quite big and as a nice outside at the back with a few bench/tables.
I'd definitely recommend it if you work in the area.

I love the vaulted ceiling (the pub is under the railway arches).

result.name: Rasoi
result.address: 10 Lincoln Street, London SW3 2TS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Delicious, inventive food, great understated service.

I was here last Saturday night with my husband and we had a lovely time. We were treated with care and served fast. The restaurant is quite classy and you can understand that from the prices - the menu is quite steep in terms of money value but I guess it's worth it. As I said, we had a really nice evening.
Simply put, superlative on every level: atmosphere, service, food, experience. Delivers on every single expectation and lives up to the reputation that precedes it.
What a food! the taste are very mouth watering and believe me, they are so tasty. The decorations they have are lovable and good in I sights. :) Good job guys.

This was one of the best meals I've ever eaten. I had the prestige 7-course tasting menu with wine pairing. Each course left we wanting more and after 7 courses I was very full. The ambiance was quite intimate, the service was excellent and the wine pairings were spot on. I can't wait to return to Rasoi.

result.name: Hollywood Arms
result.address: 45 Hollywood Road, London SW10 9HX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This is the perfect place to go for a dinner with your partner. The pub is beautifully decorated and the service is superb. Good selection of food and drinks. Highly recommend their burgers - they are really amazing.
Great local pub frequented by the best of Sloane Rangers & Sloaney Ponies Chelsea has to offer.

This is the perfect place for a drink after work. It has been renovated about two years ago, and I think it looks great now. The food is tasty and the staff is attentive. Highly recommend the beef burger - it's amazing.
Nice upstairs room for private events. Quiet street gives a bit of a remove from the hectic scene on King's Road around the corner.
A great place in a quite location in Chelsea. Good selection of food and drinks with a conservatory and upstairs lounge/private dining area.

result.name: The Assembly House
result.address: 292-294 Kentish Town Road, London NW5 2TG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Came here for the Kentish Cluster meetup and was surprised because the place is better inside than when you are just looking at it from the outside. A fine looking Victorian pub, with high ceilings, baroque wall paper and lovely etched glass. Spacious, clean and ample seating capacity for large groups. Well priced drinks and food. Highly recommended.
Really simple no frills boozer and great selection of proper beer. Ale is cask conditioned and well kept ambiance welcoming a good spot for a decent session

Lovely pub, very high ceilings and has a bit of charm about it. Good tap beer selection, I started in Japan and ended in Brooklyn! The staff are efficient and friendly, the drinks are a little above average London prices but it is right across from the tube station and close to The Forum so I would recommend it as a place to come for pre or post drinks. We came across some fun characters to chat and to share our nachos with - the place generally has a very friendly, easy going vibe about it.

Right next to Kentish Town tube, the Assembly house is a nice old corner pub. 

I met some friends there for a couple of drinks one evening and it was a good spot to do so.

The first pint wasn't particularly fresh or enjoyable, I never leave a beer but I had to leave this one. Although the second pint of Camden Pale was much better.

Probably one to go to if you love sports, they have a big screen and a couple of smaller ones.

The decor is quite nice though, comfortable.
Best pub in Kentish town. Nice staff and plenty of tables. Also nice roof, and man I love a good roof.

result.name: Gay Hussar
result.address: 2 Greek Street, London W1D 4NB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A unique restaurant that offers good hearty winter weather food. Make sure you sit upstairs to be in a more relaxed environment. The food itself was great and the service very helpful. Maybe it's due to its location in Soho but the prices are a bit steep but well worth a visit if you have a tastecard, 50% off. (Visit - 30/10/2014 Dinner Service)

Visited on the off change as we were passing. Service was attentive and decent selection on the menu. I cant say im familiar with Hungarian fair but the food was hearty and (after a bottle of the bulls blood wine!) all tasted like good hearty home cooking. Its got a lovely family feel though given its location could do with a lick of paint and a bit of a spruce on the menu. We had a taste card so got 50% off which was about what i felt the meal was worth.

The Gay Hussar is an impressive sight, with numerous charicatures of political figures staring down on you while you eat. While you might think it would be slightly offputting to have Alistair Cambell leer at you while you eat, the food more than makes up for this. The schnitzel is divine, and the slow roast duck leg and breast is perfect. It is also on the Taste Card scheme, which gives you 50% off your food bill, and unlike many restaurants they accept it on fridays and weekends.

A fun place with hearty dishes. Central European/Hungarian fare, so it might be a bit 'stodgy' for some, but it's a cosy (if a bit crammed) establishment that makes for a refreshing change from chain restaurants. Good ambiance and a wall of fame of patrons past that will impress and amuse.

Homely food with loads of flavour and good portions.

Friendly staff and great value for money.

result.name: Wenlock Arms
result.address: 26 Wenlock Road, London N1 7TA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This pub has been thoroughly cleaned up over the past couple of years - but is still very much a friendly, local pub. 

The range of ales is still excellent, the food is still served in suitably generous portions (I thoroughly recommend the salt beef sandwich - but only if you're REALLY hungry), and the staff are still friendly. 

For those of you who remember the old loos, they are GONE! Replaced by modern, clean loos that you can bear to be near. Great result.

If you get a chance to inspect the mosaics in the doorways, see if you can spot the artist's secret "signature".

Marvellous place. Old corner pub, cleaned-up but not too modernised. Very much a CAMRA real-ale place with huge range of beers. But also still a real locals' place with genuine character and style.The combination of customers works very well; when we, as visitors, were offered the free plate of sausage & roast potatoes, the locals rightly called foul, but it was all very friendly...

Great old world boozer. You'd never find it unless you were looking for it as it's tucked away on a quiet backstreet. A former working man's pub being slowly surrounded by new flats but its kept its character. Other real ale and craft beer places in London get gentrified into being great drinkers pubs, this place has been the real deal since forever.
A decent place and alright drinks, although the atmosphere was a bit too "East End" for me personally. It's a shame the piano sits unused while the darts board gets the soul banged out of it.

It's a traditional British pub, well known for its wide selection of beers. The place is unpretentious and cosy, and best of all, everything is reasonably priced. The food is also pretty good and generously-sized.

result.name: 93 Feet East
result.address: The Old Truman Brewery, 150 Brick Lane, London E1 6QL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: One of the worst pieces of crap I have ever been to. Waffen SS security check. Awful security people. Cheap music and vomit EVERYWHERE. atmosphere was also awful.
Tired dull bar/club. How it is still alive is anyone's guess. I used to be a big clubber at one point and I always remember this place for average nights out.

Personal preference but the music on my visit was not to my taste. However decent selection of drinks and service was quick and painless. Security is tight and the bathroom leave alot to be desired but no worse than other late night establishments in the area. If r&b is your thing then pop alone for a look.
They gave me beer in bad condition (red stripe), smelling like shit and wired taste, and manager said it was ok, they didn't exchanged. I invite the manager to drink it and I have to buy a Guinness.
cheap and crazy. you can play ping pong and dance. weekends are better!

result.name: The Box Soho
result.address: 11-12 Walker's Court, London W1F 0SD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Maybe one of the rudest clubs! Got told q was about 20 mins (6 people in front) not 1 in 1 out either and after 30 mins n rain starting I wanted 2 find out what was going on seems as it was a friends bday. I got told we prob ant getting in so what do they think it is fun waiting for them 2 play god..... absolute c###s AVOID if u want fun not drama oh n fake goldie on door that must pump him self full of steroriods that he has 2 act like a big man for the lack of trouser snake he has!!! P.s u can always get hold of his snake 2 get in if u r that desperate 2 rub shoulders with pretentious idiots. Thanks for making my friends bday so supper special the box!!!

The Box used to be the best club in London, especially when Dino and Chris were at the door. But now (July 2014) only the junkie and useless people get in and some rich tourists think it's cool because they hear the old stories. I don't wanna give names but the black girl at the door constantly smokes while working and the guy is lying to everyone - nothing is done professionally. Not worth waiting, just junkies around. Rubbish

Bouncers are complete idiots. Great club once you are inside, but bouncers treat customers like animals.They have this self-power thing going on, where they lose sense of reality and think they are god like. After 11pm, unless you have paid for some mega table or personally know someone, good luck. Club is trapped in a bubble and staff are delusional. Not a way to live your life.

WTF waste one hour in the queue only to talk to door manager which whisper to my ear that I can only get in if I buy bottle of Chapman!? Basically they are trying to create the impression of the gods club and other shit.
BOX = delusion, brain wash and manipulation techniques.

Best night out!! I loved the intriguing atmosphere, sort of like a secret place where anything goes. The show was quite interesting and it definitely spiked up the night. It was a fun, different, naughty night!

result.name: The Water Rats
result.address: 328 Gray's Inn Road, Camden, London WC1X 8BZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
A gig venue, not really a place you can go after work we found out, as it was £4 entry to have a drink and carry our laptop bags, maybe we went on a particular busy day. There didn't seem to be many workers in suits in there.

If you are in the area and want to see a band, I'm sure this place would be great, if you are wanting a quiet drink, probably best to go to The Queens Head.
Saw Baroness here in 2006, one of the best gigs of my life.

A really nice place with very friendly staff. I went there to watch a friend perform and thought the space was nice, there was a great crowd and the beer wasn't too expensive. A nicely hidden place to drink.

The pub had a generally unfriendly and unpleasant atmosphere. The reason for my attendance was because of a small gig I wanted to attend. The gig was good and both of the acoustic artists were very pleasant! However, the attendance for the gig was dead, and with good reason. The venue had no seating, the staff were unfriendly and the drinks were expensive and watered down! In conclusion, if you're at Grays Inn Road, it would be a very good and wise decision to go to The Lucas Arms across the road!

One of those places that's so small, if you take a step off the stage, you're buying a drink at the bar. Despite the tiny size, it has some great acts playing here-- some spruisingly big names, sometimes. It's got alotof good associations with it, and teh only really problem (aside from buying tickets) is that the sound is often not set up right for the size of the venue, so it ends up buzzy at the louder bits.

result.name: The Spaniards
result.address: Spaniards Road, Hampstead, London NW3 7JJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: One of London's oldest pubs, a best reward you can give yourself after a long walk in Hampstead Heath Park. Indulge in refreshing drink and great food, they have variety of fish dishes which are freshly delivered daily from a day-boat fish supplier. They have a massive garden and dogs are welcome to come along if you happen to be a pet owner that is. They cater even to the most persnickety pooch as organic dog food and a dog-wash is available too. This place has earned a place in the history books, quite literally. Dickens immortalised it in The Pickwick Papers, and it's said that Keats wrote Ode to a Nightingale here as well. It can not be denied that this place brings out the best in them to write,

If you have been to Hampstead Heath you will know, once you venture onto it, you will be wanting a pub and a bit of food, the Spaniards is walkable and always a good end point. There are bus stops outside so if you are wanting to stop walking totally, you can just hop on a bus back towards the tube.

Once it is hot weather, the Spaniards comes into its own, as they have a massive outdoor area, great food, good service, the perfect place to spend a Sunday afternoon. 

The only issue is the queues, since it can get really busy, they have an order at the bar policy, you can be waiting ages for the food, but as I said before the food is pretty amazing, so my advice, get a drink for the queue.

We went last night me and a biker mate. The food atmosphere staff and garden was just magic in fact absolutely exquisite .Thank you so much. I live in Hampstead my friend came up from Guildford for the evening. The twinkly lights in the garden especially and stunning glady shrubberies and exotic plants etc all over the Inn makes this one of London s best places to frequent .perfect .

Lovely looking pub but the food was an absolute let down. I had fish & 'fries' - it was oily which stayed with me for the rest of the evening. Possibly old oil. The chips were nothing to write home about either small and thin. My girlfriend had the Gnocchi which I tasted and thought was horrible! As she did. I certainly couldn't have eaten it. Just wrong. The thing that makes it worse is the price.. it looks like they're trying to go high end but are lacking quality in the food department. Sadly, probably the last time we'll visit as it looks great from the outside.
The service was excellent, informative & friendly. The food was par excellence. Desserts superb. We will certainly be going there again.

result.name: Cittie of Yorke
result.address: 22 High Holborn, London WC1V 6BN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: We had a group of 9 there last night, including 2 people in our group who were having birthdays. One of us brought a small (very small) birthday cake and asked the bar staff for a butter knife to cut the cake. They refused, and proceeded to call us rude for bringing in a birthday cake when they were still serving food. I don't recall seeing birthday cake on the menu, and all of us had planned to eat there (we were waiting for reasonable table space), but due to the poor service, we finished our drinks and went to a Wetherspoons nearby instead and had a great time.

It's a great place to go to as a tourist but not so amazing as a local if you've been in a couple times, in my opinion. The beer is cheap, but the bottled Samuel Smith's fare is much better than what's available on draught, so spend the extra money. 

Visually very interesting, it's best suited as a place along a pub crawl rather than an all-night destination. With so many interesting and varied restaurants nearby, the only reason to eat here is the atmosphere. The booths make a nice little snug space if you want to have a secret meeting with someone, or just to hole up with a book by yourself.

This is a really great pub that has an air of the baronial about it. There are two ground floor bars and one cellar bar. The food is good and the atmosphere is fantastic. The rear ground floor bar has a series of intimate little booths to sit in, although you need to get there early in the evening if you want to be sure of getting one of these. Have a look at the fire which has a unique system of getting rid of the smoke, the smoke goes down!
The beer is Sam Smiths.
It looks so awesome here. The cider and the lager are awesome and the atmosphere is fantastic. I like it!
Beautiful ye olde style pub, with oak caskets on the walls and plenty of seating. When I visited on a Tuesday evening, it wasn't too busy and the staff were super nice. Definitely a hidden gem!

result.name: Electric Brixton
result.address: Town Hall Parade, Brixton, London, SW2 1RJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Proper decent venue nowadays! Great sound, lighting, etc... and the staff were cool and welcoming all night long... even into the early hours! Dancefloor was packed and the atmosphere was perfect. Good night!

Saturday 15th March The ORB.

My ticket stated the Doors would open at 10pm, but we was all kept outside for the Film Crew to get in their places until 10.30pm and it was very cold.

The Bottled Water (saka) can be purchased at Tesco's for 29p, so why does this club charge £3.50?

Some area's in the club are dark and you can't see some of the Steps, white paint will prevent further falls and spillages.

Huge Bottleneck on the Balcony after The ORB had finished playing.

Anyone caught Cat Napping will be chucked out immediately.

No Locks in the Ladies Lavatories 

My ticket stated that closing time was 6am, but we was all chucked out at 4.30am. However, I did overhear that this was because everyone was drinking Tap Water and No alcohol was being purchased.

Friendly approachable Crew, plenty of Bar Staff, so no time wasted waiting.

Will I go again?

Defiantly.

Decent gig venue now. Came here for a few late nighters when it was still The Fridge and it was a little sweat box. They seem to have mostly fixed that problem now. They also attract some good bands and DJs here, though the venue is fairly small so you often need to be quick to secure tickets.

Really great venue to see live music as it is smaller then Brixton Academy it feels a bit more intimate. The seating area upstairs gives a great view and where ever you stand you don't feel miles away from the stage! It is about 5 min walk from the underground station too which is perfect!
Amazing venue in London!

result.name: Ye Olde Cock Tavern
result.address: 22 Fleet Street, London EC4Y 1AA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: beer (festival on.),. But Pepsi, not coke......milady is not best pleased. It has a oldie worldly look in a modern way. Probably the refurb it had. I know, I worked on it.

This pub is OK, it isn't my favourite pub in town but I would happily include this on a Fleet Street crawl (well worth doing!) On the plus side, from the exterior it looks like a real old London pub and the inside has a pubby feel although slightly faux Victorian era. Food is very average.
Interior is a bit too modern for my tastes. Other than that not bad I suppose.

The pub does not have any single qualities that make it stand out from the rest. But the atmosphere is just right to go out with friends have a couple of drinks and chat, also the food is pretty standard for a pub. The music is always the right volume, not to loud at all and there is always a table to be found. If it is the same bar keeps as a couple years back they are quite knowledgable about what's on tap and are good for a chat.
I came to watch some football. Not much going on in the fd on the weekend. Nice pub.

result.name: Kai Mayfair
result.address: 65 South Audley Street, London W1K 2QU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Really fancy, kinda pricy! But worth the pennies or pences! wtvr pounds! Very deliciopus and sophisticated looking food! i wish I owned it!

Went with a few friends, highly recommended for a business dinner or treating your loved ones. Chef Alex Chow's menu is truly inspirational - taking Chinese food to the next level by combining modern ingredients. The wasabi prawns are a must have and if you feel indulgent the Wagyu beef is truly amazing - very juicy, tender and just the right combination of flavours to melt in your mouth. Dishes such as Lamb with Szechuan Peppercorn were nice and definitely very creative. Soft shell crab was also good but I think Hutong's is slightly better (IMO). 

 Kai has an extensive wine and cocktail list which is handy if you have many people to please. Deserts were also great the ‘Peranakan’ mango cake was amazing and one fellow diner enjoyed the six shades of chocolate. Service was discreet and prompt, cannot fault the manageress or host, everything was smooth without being too overbearing and all requests were managed carefully. Not your everyday Chinese but truly one of the top contenders if not The Best Chinese restaurant in the UK fully deserving of its Michellin star status.
Disappointing. Much of the dishes no better than those found in China town, but with multiple times price tag. Avoid this pretentious overhyped place

Went here for my birthday and I absolutely loved my time at Kai Mayfair. 

The standout dishes were the Wasabi prawns, and the Roasted Chilean Seabass which I absolutely recommend to everyone! The prawns were juicy, and the accompanying wasabi mayonnaise was delightfully creamy . The Seabass was incredibly tangy and addictive. 

Kai Mayfair is definitely a place worth considering next time you want to treat yourself!

Service at Kai is a bit tardy, but the food makes up for it! The roast duck was like none I've had before in London, the wasabi prawns had just the right amount of wasabi and the slow-cooked Egg with black truffle was cooked to perfection. The highlight of our meal though was "cài with 3 chillies" - a vegetarian(!) main our waiter recommended - triple fried tofu that was just out of this world.

Eating at Kai is likely to dent your wallet quite a bit - but it's well worth it. Very upmarket, very sophisticated and well deserving of it's Michelin star. The one thing this place lacks is a decent cocktail list - but the wine list is a-OK.

result.name: Larkfield Priory Hotel
result.address: 802 London Road, Maidstone, Kent ME20 6HJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: The first impressions were quite good staff were friendly and helpful it all looked great until you enter Your room ,room one had fleas !! room two was better no fleas but the bed was a throwback to the 70's and looked it too had masking tape round the bedbase holding the material in place radiator clanging an banging most of the night too won't be going back sorry
Comfortable. Clean and friendy more than I expected would recommend and would stay again
Andrew. Lofty. Tree ﻿

result.name: The Elgin
result.address: 96 Ladbroke Grove, London W11 1PY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: My local. Great bar and nice beer and very convenient to get to from Maids Vale station. Food not so great; you're better off going to the Truscott.
Kind staff. The service isn't fast. We had dinner with very loud live music and was hard to speak. Recommended only if you like live music
Staff friendly when not busy. Unfortunately the real ale is not kept in good condition. Always f@rting like thunder the following morning.
Great pub, good selection of drinks and friendly staff. Quite pricey, but the same as everywhere else near. Great quiz on a Sunday. I have been and won a few times.

Went for drinks on a busy saturday night. it's a really nice bar, the bar is well stocked with liquor and the the areas wrap around the bar neatly. first area is a pure pub, second area is pub / dining area, thirdly, there's a dining area next to a stage. Saturday night there was a live band, and it was actually a quite decent band at that.

Bar staff despite being rushed off their feet were nice and friendly. literally a minute walk from ladbroke grove station.

result.name: Grosvenor House
result.address: Grosvenor House Hotel, 86-90 Park Lane, London W1K 7TN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Not a true 5 star 5 diamond hotel. Out of the variety of 5 star hotels in London this is the least desirable. Hotel shows its age in smell and decor. Room prices are ridiculous and the standard room size is extremely small. I'm usually very satisfied with JW in the states. This was a huge let down from front desk checkin to the actual room. Wish I had done a bvlgari, ritz Carlton, or even a plain Marriott brand instead of this jw grosvenor. Does not meet American 5 star standards.

Their amenities and facilities look great agreeable, the pattern was extraordinarily astonishing. The service was first-rate as well. Really, I've had cool experiences here at Marriot hotel. It's certainly in the costly series, but on the other hand the cuisine quality more than makes up for it. Their food, each was exceptional, but the one I be keen on the most are the room that I checked in. The ambiance is just not ordinarily but utterly ideal. Very roomy within and the outside places area are beautiful. There's also a bar area inside and larger seating areas for big groups.

result.name: Thai Square
result.address: 2-4 Lower Richmond Rd, London SW15 1LB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I've been there many times, because of the stunning view to the river. I really love the romantic atmosphere in this restaurant. Good music and friendly staff. I just want to give them an advice to improve some of their dishes. I'd come back soon :)

Eat here last night and found the food bland and the prices exorbitant. You pay for fancy decor and atmosphere but the food was a big disappointment. Starters were tiny, bland (ribs and fish cakes). Pretty vegetable sculpture did not counterbalance the bland food. Pad thai was very bland indeed. Beef in black bean tasted like it came out of a jar, ditto vegetables in oyster sauce. All for £56 with one beer.
Much improved from previous visit. Although the menu is familiar there was a definite improvement. Staff was nicer too.

We were there on a Saturday night when the place was near full. There's a nice view over the river and a generally welcoming atmosphere, but a bit of a cramped feeling due to the density of the tables. Some of the smaller tables under the lifted gallery look a bit oppressed. The food is generally good, I would say it's the best feature of the place: on a sunny midday where the place is less packed the whole experience is probably really nice. The ground floor bar looks relatively lively, but I had a slight feeling it was trying to be something it wasn't. At about 81 pounds for 2 cocktails (one non alcoholic), one mixed starter, three mains, coconut rice, espresso and a sweet, it's a bit less cheap than I would expect a chain of this kind to be.

Is a nice place to eat thai food and after that you can get down from the restaurant to the the dance floor and enjoy it a nice time there, drinks are good and prices are good. The music are very nice and the view to the river is amazing specially in summer time.

result.name: Berry Bros. & Rudd
result.address: 3 St. James Street, London SW1A 1EG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: My wife loves sitting at the fireside with a bottle of good wine. That was the reason I visited this store. I just wanted to surprise her. Because of my total lack of information it was a very hard task. This place is full of high quality wines. The competent salesman literally became my saviour. I was impressed with his attentiveness and patient. He helped me to choose the perfect wine with intense and rich flavour. My wife loved it. I'm so grateful.

Wonderful staff - who made excellent wine recommendations!

Be sure to try the wines bottled under their own label.

If you like ginger - you should pick up one of the small bottles of the King's Ginger that they have on the counter (or at least did when I visited in June 2014). I wish I had bought a couple more of those.

It is definitely a good wine source for you to drink at home or your office. Although, it's quite costly, you'll get what you paid for. You can even try out the wines with their label. It's fantastic. If you are looking for a store with a great wine selection, that this place is the one for you.

A bit out of my personal budget, but a very good place to source wine for the office. The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful - made me comfortable even though I wasn't dressed to blend in with the rest of their clientele.

Purchased a bottle of fine cognac as a birthday gift, as I'm not a cognac drinker I knew very little on the subject. Berry Bros & Rudd's service was excellent, their extremely knowledge staff were able to recommend a bottle of Delamain Cognac. Not cheap at £250 for a bottle, but the recipient of the gift was impressed.

result.name: The Tottenham
result.address: 6 Oxford Street, London W1D 1AN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Cozy, it wasn't full of people in a sarurday night. Great service, although they don't ley you pay with card for less than 5 pounds. I actually liked this place

Went to lunch here and had a great time, the hamburger was great and the cottage pie quite good but was served very hot.
If your hangry this is a solid choise
Horrible. Contender for worst London pub.
Nice temperature. Music was great until they played The Joker.
Extremely cramped and grimy toilets, nice otherwise

result.name: Old Red Lion Theatre
result.address: 418 Saint John Street, London EC1V 4NJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
If you fancy a drink in an old fashioned, original London boozer, Angel’s oldest pub The Old Red Lion Theatre is where to head. Born in 1415, due to the fringe theatre upstairs and football screenings, the patronage is a really mixed bag. This oddity is one of the things that sets the Old Red Lion apart from other pubs in the area; you never know who you’ll meet at the bar. 
Inspired by his love of public houses, owner Damien took over the Old Red in 1999 and runs it as a family business. This TSL favourite does all sorts - but definitely check out their ‘Comedy Commentary‘, a hilarious event during which a roster of talented comedians take turns in commentating over live football on the big screen. 

Check out our website Twenty Something London for more on great local places.

What's not to love about this place. The Pub is a great old pub with warm fireplaces and an atmosphere as what i would describe as a genuine local community spirt. Its hard to describe but popping in here on a cold winters night for a drink is like entering a welcoming ye olde inn.Perfect for cold nights! The pub is great. And the theatre behind it is superb. Its very small but they put on excellent plays. Because it's so intimate you cant but help be swept along. 
A really good atmosphere, a good crowd a great pub and a great theatre. What more could you ask for?

I adore that theatre which I visit regularly. It's very small (no more than 50 seats), but the quality of the plays is usually very good. And it's cheaper than seeing a film in the West End in 3D ! (around £12). The pub is nothing special, but it has a garden and serves a good selection of ales. It's also very well located in one of the best area of London for bars and restaurants.

The Old Red Lion is associated in the past with Thomas Paine, William Hogarth and Dr Samuel Johnson. Today it is a charming, old fashioned and relaxed pub, which is now thought to be a lot older than the date 1415.

Very intimate theatre above pub. Hard wooden bench seats. Be prepared for the actors to perform literally right in front of you (not the place if you are shy and like to just sit back and blend into the crowd, especially if the performance is 'interactive').

result.name: The Jamaica Wine House
result.address: St Michael's Alley, Cornhill, London EC3V 9DS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Lovely traditional pub. The food is not great in variety but everything offered is quite delicious and well-cooked.
Too full most of the time to be really fun. Relatively expensive, and very much for the 'suits'. But if you're with tourists who want an old fashioned pub, this is a great place to go during the day.
Interesting history and still a fairly nice interior.

result.name: San Lorenzo
result.address: 22 Beauchamp Place, London SW3 1NH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Very warm friendly family run Italian restaurant, truly authentic Italian food, complimented by a traditional decor. I love both the conservatory area when I am with a party, but when I am enjoying a romantic meal with my wife I prefer the more intimate tables. I would definitely recommend Lorenzo's if you enjoy traditional Italian food and hospitality.

Great service from the staff here, as always. Everyone very friendly and welcoming. Food is great, especially for me with my food intolerances, they were very helpful indeed. The chicken and balsamic reduction was always my favourite, with the most delicious mashed potato :-)

Quality restaurant in the center of London. It has very classy and sophisticated appeal. It's suitable for business meetings or casual family dinner, whatever you like. The food is good but the menu needs a little variety. Anyway, the restaurant is great and I recommend it.

On of the old standards in upmarket Italian dining in London. Everything is done with a flourish.
We have never been disappointed and always amused.
goood, authentic italian with average service and improvable decor. recommended overall if you are planning to go to wimbledon or live in the area.

result.name: Chez Bruce
result.address: 2 Bellevue Road, Wandsworth Common, London SW17 7EG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: On arrival we were shown to our table immediately, unfortunately they had so many tables in the restaurant we had to squeeze past several and also pull out our table so one of us could get to their seat. Very good food. Nothing to complain about except maybe the bread basket that could be improved. Service of Salmon Tartare with many textures and colors that was delicious. The cheese biscuits and bread were world class. Tasted the button sized Fish Cakes with Ginger and Yoghurt as well.

Lively high-end restaurant in South West London - food was good, and quite reasonably priced given the quality of the food. They have an excellent wine list, including (unusually) some great English wine. I would recommend the champagne trifle. 

This isn't quite up there with a Marcus Wareing or Gordon Ramsay place, but it's in the top 20 in London.
My favourite restaurant. Life is divided up into manageable chunks of time between visits to Chez Bruce.

My boyfriend took me to Chez Bruce last Friday to celebrate our 2 year anniversary of being together. I really enjoyed the posh decoration, the sophisticated atmosphere and the accommodating staff. Furthermore the menu was quite diverse and I honestly had a hard time deciding what to order as everything seemed so delicious. I had the Roast cod with olive oil mash and gremolata and its taste clearly revealed the finesse with which it had been cooked. 
Without a doubt one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. Strongly recommend it.
Excellent food, service and reasonable value. Wine selection is beyond extensive!

result.name: The Westbourne
result.address: 101 Westbourne Park Villas, London W2 5ED, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This pub is always packed.. I know most of you would say it's a good sign, but I prefer much more quiet places. However, the food they offer is delicious and not pricey at all. 
Try the calf's liver and you won't be disappointed.

Great place to meet friends with ample seating and standing space outside when the sun's out. Decent wine list and food menu too, but if it's not to your liking you have always got the Cow Pub directly opposite.
Rude and apathetic staff. Expensive. A good range of nice ales.

Gastropub with a yard. What else could you ask for? Amazing food and good beers. The prices are very reasonable and this is the best place to grab a drink on a warm evening- its yard is just the loveliest place around Notting Hill area.

The Westbourne is an amazing pub with great food, It's an excellent place to go to with friends or even on a date. It's cosy and relaxed but has restaurant-worthy food. They change their menu on a daily basis and have food to share as well as full meals for 1. On top of that they have a very elaborate wine menu. It's a place that's mostly visited by locals rather than tourists. If you go there, I'll guarantee you'll have a lovely evening!

result.name: Aura Mayfair
result.address: 48-49 Saint James's Street, London SW1A 1JT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Aura is a place where the rich and famous come to visit have a few drinks and a laugh. We all had a fantastic time as always the staff are the nicest people friendly and always have a laugh with us.
Ok we are not famous but all work in the city and love this place for a few drinks at the weekend. it is expensive but if you want to come to Aura you pay your money, you want cheep drinks go to Weatherspoon's or your dive bar in the more rougher parts of London. Aura provides amazing music nice classy people and a great atmosphere £20 for drinks is normal its MAYFAIR not leyton

A very selective club with amazing party. 
The music is good and high quality service.The line to the club was big but we went fast and without any problems ( and for free!) Anyway the venue itself looks very nice - glamorous like we wanted it. Our table with drinks were perfect (thanks to lux glist, really cool guys! So we were dancing all night and I would say that I might back to Aura Mayfair. The people around were good looking and having fun - that what I wanted from such place. I think we will return!
Rude door staff, way too many people in the small space. No actual dancefloor and very boring generic music. There are much better places in central for a fun night out!
great place to party, great staff, good music. great cocktail. lots of good music and celebrites are hangin around the place.
Has a 'modern' Turkish decor that needs updating! White seats needs replacing.

result.name: The 606 Club
result.address: 90 Lots Road, London SW10 0QD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I can't believe more people don't go here! I took my boyfriend's parents who are very into jazz, and despite not being a jazz fan myself every single person had a blast.
We saw Ola Onabule - it was intimate, professional, and 100% entertaining. Would very highly recommend going on a night to see him.

Jazz as it should be. This little cosy gem of a place is located in a basement near Chelsea Harbour Way and is a great place for a night out on any day of the week. Due to the small size you'll be guaranteed a clear view of the musicians who play every night. This establishment also offers a tasty selection of dishes that change each week. As this place does get quite busy, try to book in advance to avoid disappointment!

The 606 has been around for 35 years, run by musician Steve Rubie, renowned as the place to hear the best of British jazz every single night. Many infamous late-night hangouts have happened in the basement club – we can’t name names, or tell stories though… but according to the cheeky little’n Jamie Cullum, 606 is “London’s best music venue”. And he ought to know.

In an unexpectedly industrial feeling location around Chelsea Harbour way, you'd be forgiven for thinking you were looking for number 606. You aren't - that's in homage to where the club originally was on King's Road. Now it's accessed via a red brick arch, an intercom and a jaunt through the blissful Boho mild chaos of the front office, which reveals this gem of a club and it's true sabby chic, intimate, interior. It fits 165, but really just feels like someone's amazing front room. With live music and food.

It’s a small club with tables radiating out from the stage in the centre. Wherever you sit, you’ll get a great view. With musicians every day, sometimes twice, you can be assured that every effort has gone into getting the very best acts out there. This is a true jazz club just as it should be.
The music is exceptional, the venue perfect but service is patchy and the food could be described, at best as pub food.
Classy club! very intimate atmosphere and music for the soul. I remember so many things when hearing it...

result.name: Murano
result.address: 20 Queen Street, London, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: So glad i came here for dinner. I loved the idea of picking whatever you like from the menu and decided which course you would like it for, rather than being restricted by only set starters and mains. I ordered Gnocci to start and it was perfectly cooked with fresh peas, and a nicely small portion so that you dont feel too full. I then had pork belly with chorizo and tempura courgette flowers. The pork belly was so tender and flavoursome, it may just be the best thing i've ever eaten, and the whole plate was balanced beautifully. For dessert i chose a mango brulee with passion fruit jel and chocolate. The brulee itself was lovely but i did find that there was too much chocolate, and the richness did not lend itself well with the mango which was suprising. i did however taste their pistaccio soufle with chocolate sauce which was heavenly. The sommelier was very friendly and informative and made great reccomendations based on tastes and food that was ordered. The restaurant itself is comfortable and stylish, with staff to match, without being snobby. Will definately book again.

Acceptable food an averagely competent cook could prepare at home on a weekday when tired. Pasta bland. Boring meat with (packet?) gravy. Lonely on a large plate the lemon tart was edible. We visited on rainy 21st December 2013. The beige and grey Art Wrecko decor was quite depressing were it not for the lovely staff who added the only colour.
But Michelin star?? Bizarre!

Great place in the middle of Mayfair. Very attentive service, friendly and approachable. Food was very good indeed. Lunch set menu is excellent value. This is italian fine dining on a high level. They look very well after children too. We will be back!

Excellent food! The menu was so good, it was difficult to decide what to have and what we had was totally amazing. The somelier was very helpful and friendly. Decor was modern and flowers on the table beautiful. Service had room for improvement. Although the head waiter was very nice, I have seen better service at this level of restaurant elsewhere.
Outstanding all round. Food was incredible, wine was great, service was friendly but formal; we had a table looking through the window into the kitchen which was really cool. A great experience...

result.name: The George Tavern
result.address: 373 Commercial Road, London E1 0LA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Fantastic pub, arts venue, music venue. Seen some great bands here and some fantastic theatre and comedy. The closed down stepney's nightclub here is home to the famous multi coloured dance floor from the Pulp video, but is unfortunately under threat by developers. Tragic

Great pub, excellent atmosphere, good bands, there was a play on upstairs which my mate was in, a lot of graffiti in the toilets.. Someone said that watching bands in there makes you feel like you're in a British film or an episode of Byker Grove.

Unexpectedly fun pub tucked down a not-fun street in Stepney. Legendary club nights, ultra-friendly bar staff, wobbly closing times. Don't go if you like things smart; this shabby gem is only for those who don't mind a floor with the odd sawdust remnant.
Its a great fun place if you like random.. definitely a jewel in the east.
Amazing pub

result.name: Searcys: The Gherkin
result.address: 30 St Mary Axe, London EC3A 8EP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Been on the top floor of Searcy's and it sports an amazing view. They also provide free wifi (although connection can be unstable at times). I would recommend this for fancy private events. They also do sumptuous food - probably the best canapes I've tasted in my life.

Visited The Gherkin on a couple of occasions. It's great view and atmosphere. We visited last week but unfortunately our table wasn't booked for the time requested. This was a bit disappointing. It was nonetheless a great experience that I will treasure as it's not every day that you get to go.
great views, nice cocktails!
a must see, even if they won't let you in

We've enjoyed a long term relationship with (untitled). They managed a number of online projects for us, including our main ecommerce website. They're a hugely creative bunch with a great in-house technical team.

They have a great habit of always delivering that little extra that makes a huge difference!

result.name: The Black Lion
result.address: 2 South Black Lion Lane, London W6 9TJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: The pub is nice and well decorated. We went with a big to celebrate the company´s summer party. They had pre-booked the terrace & bbq which was only for us. The food was prepared on the bbq (the quality was medium). The terrace is nice because they have a good space with many tables and you can also play to table tennis. They played good commercial music and we were dancing there. It was a nice evening.
Great place with good food and seasonal events

Heaven forbid you don't want to get wasted in this place. The owner makes it clear that to serve coffee is such a chore and actually verbally disses me in my presence!! So rude!! and I will happily spend my money in the super friendly local establishments like the local old ship and cross keys. Thanks for making my mind up #PoorService #PoorManners

A group of us booked a table at 2pm on a Sunday only to be told kitchen was closed and we couldn't get food for another hour. After deciding to leave, we were told by the waitress we'd get pushed to the front of the queue as we had booked the table, so food would take 20 minutes (even though we were originally told kitchen was closed?). When we ordered, we then ended up waiting for about 50 minutes before getting food anyway. Food (roast) was pricey but good portions, tasty and got a free drink for having to wait so long. A few of us have ended up with upset tummies the day after. All in all a bit of a mixed bag, but certainly won't be going back in a hurry.
I guess a nice location and decor makes up for the rude staff, disappointing food and dodgy ale...

result.name: Bush Hall
result.address: 310 Uxbridge Road, London W12 7LJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Bush hall is a beautiful venue with a very relaxed and enjoyable vibe. The venue has this great dichotomy created by the ostentatious decor and the chilled out staff.

My girlfriend and I travelled here to watch Needtobreathe supported by Ella the Bird (who I highly recommend), I immediately felt at ease in a room that was full but not overcrowded with other good folk ready to appreciate some soothing tones.
My favourite music venue. Love the cosiness and chandeliers.

I've been to a comedy show and a gig here, and everything from the shabby old decor to the balcony viewing and smoking patio above the street steep the place in a warm and inviting atmosphere.
